Title: How do I contact GXS Support or get help? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Contact_Us/How_do_I_contact_GXS_Support_or_get_help%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:08.555685

================================================================================

We are here to help!
Our GXS Customer Support Team is available 24/7, 365 days, even on public holidays.
For account or customer-related enquiries, you can reach us via the:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat (recommended)
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: Submit an enquiry
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
No access to our GXS Bank app? No problem! You can still reach us through the following channels:
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
GXS Customer Support Email:
help@gxs.com.sg
Our GXS Collections Team is available from Mondays to Fridays between 9am and 6pm, excluding public holidays.
For assistance on repayments, you can reach us via the:
GXS Hotline: (+65) 6866 6686
GXS Email:
credit@gxs.com.sg
Weâ€™re all about making your experience as smooth as possible. So reach out whenever you need and weâ€™ll respond to you as soon as we can.
Please note that the voice you hear in our messages is generated by Artificial Intelligence and is for informational purposes only. These messages will originate from phone number (+65) 6039 0308. For complete details and terms, always refer to our GXS Terms of Use.
If youâ€™d prefer to speak with a human agent, please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out to us through our official contact channels.
Important: The numbers used for these outgoing messages are not monitored for incoming calls or messages. Kindly do not attempt to call back these numbers.

Title: How do I leave a complaint? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Contact_Us/How_do_I_leave_a_complaint%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:11.686253

================================================================================

We are sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience. Please let us know how we can improve. Do contact us via any of the following channels:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: Submit an enquiry
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
GXS Customer Support Email:
help@gxs.com.sg
We will acknowledge your complaint within 2 business days and provide a resolution within 14 business days. In some cases, we may need more time to investigate the matter and we seek your understanding on this. Rest assured that we'll keep you updated.
If you'd like to appeal against our assessment, you can contact the Financial Industry Disputes Resolution Centre (FIDReC) for further assistance.
FIDReC is an impartial institution that specialises in mediating disputes between customers and financial institutions. You can visit their website at www.fidrec.com.sg or call them at +(65) 6327 8878 to see how they can help.

================================================================================

Title: I'm unable to sign up for a GXS Savings Account and received an error message that says "Itâ€™s not you, itâ€™s us", what should I do? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Sign_Up_Issues/I'm_unable_to_sign_up_for_a_GXS_Savings_Account_and_received_an_error_message_that_says_%22It%E2%80%99s_not_you%2C_it%E2%80%99s_us%22%2C_what_should_I_do%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:20.901457

================================================================================

We are here to help! One common reason could be because you're not physically located in Singapore at the time of application. We suggest you try again when you're back in Singapore.
Another reason could be that your mobile device is connected to a Virtual Private Network (VPN). To re-apply for a GXS Savings Account, youâ€™ll need to disable your VPN before we are able to process your application. You can turn it back on thereafter.
Need further assistance? You may reach out to us in one of the following ways:
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
GXS Customer Support Email:
help@gxs.com.sg

Title: I got the message "Sorry! Your MyInfo details are incomplete." when applying for a GXS Savings Account. What information is needed and what should I do? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:26.886254

================================================================================

To open a GXS Savings Account, your personal information on Singpass Myinfo has to be accurate and up to date.
Here are the details we'll need from your Singpass Myinfo to process your application:
NRIC / FIN
Name
Hanyu Pinyin Name
Alias Name
Sex
Registered Address
Email
Date of Birth
Country / Place of Birth
Nationality / Citizenship
Occupation
CPF Employers
Employerâ€™s Name
Marital Status
Pass Expiry Date
Mobile Number
Residential Status
Pass Type
Once you've updated your personal details in Singpass Myinfo, you're all set to re-apply for a GXS Savings Account. We're looking forward to having you on board!
If you are encountering issues with your Singpass login, do have a read
here
.

Title: What should I do if I canâ€™t access my GXS accounts using Singpass login? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Sign_Up_Issues/What_should_I_do_if_I_can%E2%80%99t_access_my_GXS_accounts_using_Singpass_login%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:32.930769

================================================================================

First, check if youâ€™re using the right Singpass login. You should only be accessing the GXS Bank app with your own Singpass credentials.
Here are some troubleshooting guide to help you along:
Check your internet connection to ensure it's stable
Ensure your device operating system and GXS Bank app are updated to the latest version. The latest version of GXS Bank app is available on both Apple Store and Google Play Store
Ensure that you did not block all cookies in your browser settings
It is possible you may be accessing Singpass login during a maintenance period, which prevents you from logging in to your GXS accounts successfully. Refer
here
for MyInfo maintenance schedule.
To resolve any Singpass login issues, you may contact
Singpass Helpdesk
directly.
If youâ€™ve changed your NRIC number or are still facing issues, contact us at:
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
GXS Customer Support Email:
help@gxs.com.sg

Title: Why can't I register for GXS if my mobile phone does not have passcode protection turned on? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Sign_Up_Issues/Why_can't_I_register_for_GXS_if_my_mobile_phone_does_not_have_passcode_protection_turned_on%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:39.217015

================================================================================

For security reasons, we are not able to provide access to devices which are not passcode protected. You can go to your phone settings to set a passcode or access your GXS account on a passcode-protected device.

================================================================================

Title: In cases of unauthorised transactions, will I be liable for them? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Payment_Issues/In_cases_of_unauthorised_transactions%2C_will_I_be_liable_for_them%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:42.054710

================================================================================

As an account holder, you have a duty to protect access or access codes to your account, report unauthorised transactions, provide information on unauthorised transactions, or make a police report if requested.
You will not be liable for any loss arising from an unauthorised transaction if the loss resulted from any act or omission by us, or any action or omission of any independent third party (if such loss does not exceed S$1,000), provided that you have complied with the above duties.
You will be liable for the actual loss arising from an unauthorised transaction where your recklessness was the primary cause of the loss. Recklessness would include your failure to comply with the above duties.
In all cases, we will assess and resolve claims in a fair and reasonable manner.
For full details of your duties, please refer to MAS E-payments User Protection Guidelines atÂ www.mas.gov.sg/regulation/guidelines/guidelines-for-e-payments-user-protection

================================================================================

Title: I had a payment failure due to insufficient funds. If I try again, will there be a duplicate payment? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Payment_Issues/I_had_a_payment_failure_due_to_insufficient_funds._If_I_try_again%2C_will_there_be_a_duplicate_payment%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:07:45.270166

================================================================================

You will be notified instantly if you donâ€™t have enough funds to make a payment. The transfer will not be complete, so you donâ€™t have to worry about making duplicate payments. When you receive the notification on insufficient funds, you will be prompted to add funds to your GXS Savings Account, or reduce the amount youâ€™re transferring.

Title: There was a transaction failure during two factor (2FA) authentication. How do I resolve this issue? - GXS Help Centre

================================================================================

================================================================================

Title: What happens after I report an unauthorised transaction to GXS? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Payment_Issues/What_happens_after_I_report_an_unauthorised_transaction_to_GXS%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:08:06.973046

================================================================================

After receiving all the necessary information (including a police report, if needed), we will take up to 21 working days to investigate your case thoroughly. Should we need any additional information or time, the investigation could take up to 45 working days. Once the investigation is completed you will receive an email of the outcome.
If youâ€™re not liable for any loss from the unauthorised transaction, we will credit your GXS Savings Account or waive your outstanding GXS FlexiLoan for the actual loss.
If the investigation finds that youâ€™re liable for the unauthorised transaction and youâ€™d like to dispute this assessment, you can contact Financial Industry Disputes Resolution Centre (FIDReC) for further assistance.

================================================================================

Title: What is the difference between an unauthorised transaction and an erroneous transaction? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Payment_Issues/What_is_the_difference_between_an_unauthorised_transaction_and_an_erroneous_transaction%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:08:09.885551

================================================================================

An unauthorised transaction refers to a payment transaction initiated by any person without your knowledge and consent. Such a transaction may be a transaction you don't recognise or was not made by you.
An erroneous transaction refers to a payment transaction from any account to the wrong recipient. Such a transaction may have been initiated by you and paid to the wrong person, or initiated by someone else and paid to you. This can happen if the wrong payment details (e.g. account number, phone number or NRIC) are keyed in during the transfer.

================================================================================

Title: How do I report an alleged fraud attempt or scam? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Security_Issues/How_do_I_report_an_alleged_fraud_attempt_or_scam%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:08:18.756208

================================================================================

Weâ€™re here for you every step of the way. Contact us immediately so that we can suspend your GXS Bank account(s) and take you through the fraud reporting process. Next, lodge an online police report at the Singapore Police Force (SPF) website or visit your nearest police station. Reach us at:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
Hereâ€™s an overview of the reporting process so you know what to expect. There are two steps to take when thereâ€™s a suspected fraud or scam:
Suspend your account
You can suspend your account immediately through our voice automated system or speak to one of our agents via call or Live Chat. After your account has been suspended, our agent will ask you for details such as the date and time of the incident. To suspend your account via our voice automated system,
1. Call us at 1800 866 6685 or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
2. Press 1 and verify your NRIC and date of birth. Your account will be suspended immediately.
Lodge a police report
To file a police report, you can either:
File it online: The SPF has an e-services portal where you can file certain types of reports online. Just go to their website and look for the "e-Report" section.
Call the SPF Hotline: For urgent matters that need immediate police attention, you can SMS 70999 or call '999'. For non-urgent matters, you can call '1800-255-0000'. They will advise you on the next steps, which might include filing a report in person.
Visit a police station: Head to your nearest Neighbourhood Police Centre (NPC) or Police Divisional Headquarters. The officers there will assist you with taking your report.
You may not have lost money, but this is important if youâ€™ve given your personal information to anyone claiming to be from GXS Bank via call, links, or email. Our agent will follow up with an email to request for the police report.

================================================================================

Title: How do I report an email, social media handle, website or application impersonating GXS? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Security_Issues/How_do_I_report_an_email%2C_social_media_handle%2C_website_or_application_impersonating_GXS%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:08:21.762391

================================================================================

Thanks for bringing this to our attention! Let's work together in making it a safer place for all. Just capture the screenshots of the email, social media handle or website and send them to us at
report.phishing@gxs.com.sg
. Weâ€™ll get in touch with you if we require more details. Additionally, you can also refer to the official Singapore Police Force website for the latest advisory.

Title: How do I report phishing email or messages, claiming to be from GXS, requesting for my GXS login credentials? - GXS Help Centre

================================================================================

1. Contact us immediately to suspend your account(s) and let us take you through the fraud reporting process. Here's how:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat
GXS Hotline: 1800 866 6685Â or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
2. Â Lodge a police report either through:
Online: Singapore Police Force (SPF) e-services portal.
Urgent: SMS 70999 or call '999'. Non-urgent: call '1800-255-0000'
In person: Visit any police station.
If you did not share your credentials,
Forward the email or screenshots of the messages (containing the contact details) to
report.phishing@gxs.com.sg
. Weâ€™ll get in touch with you if we need more information.
You can also refer to the official SPF website for the latest advisory, whether or not you have shared your credentials.

A subscription fee to a service, or fees charged at the end of a free trial.
To an unfamiliar business name. Some of the stores or restaurants you frequent have a different account or transaction name. Google their names to be sure.
Small fees. Some companies may charge you a small fee to make sure your payment details are accurate.

GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat (recommended)
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: Submit an enquiry

Via our voice automated system. When you call us, pressÂ '1' and verify your NRIC and date of birth. Your account will be suspended immediately.
Via one of our agents, who will help you suspend your account over call or live chat.

Title: Does GXS collect and store data from my device to detect malware and access my app usage? - GXS Help Centre

================================================================================

Our enhanced security feature detects potential malware & permissions that might put your personal and banking information at risk and informs only you of the apps that could compromise your data.
We take customersâ€™ privacy seriously. We do not collect or store any information about the apps installed on your mobile phone and how you are using them.

Title: How does GXS detect malware on my device? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/How_does_GXS_detect_malware_on_my_device%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:20.105042

================================================================================

In general, malware have certain signatures which can be detected by our enhanced security feature. The risk of malware is also higher when these security vulnerabilities are present:
Known malware applications and jailbroken or rooted mobile devices.
Apps that are not installed from trusted or official app stores with accessibility service permission enabled on your devices.
When live screen sharing,Â screen mirroring or screen recording is detected.
Apps that allow remote access to your device.

================================================================================

Title: How do I change the accessibility settings for third-party apps that I have downloaded on my device? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/How_do_I_change_the_accessibility_settings_for_third-party_apps_that_I_have_downloaded_on_my_device%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:23.441767

================================================================================

Accessibility settings is currently available on Android devices. The steps to change accessibility settings for third-party apps differ for different phone models.
Generally, the steps are as follows:
Tap on your deviceâ€™s setting app
Scroll down and select â€˜accessibilityâ€™
Scroll until you find the accessibility service or feature you need to disable
Tap the toggle switch to turn off the feature
Via Home Screen shortcut
Press and hold on an empty spot on your home screen
Tap on the â€˜widgetsâ€™ icon
Swipe through the widgets until you reach the â€˜settings shortcutâ€™ widget
Drag and drop the widget onto your home screen
Choose 'accessibilityâ€™ from the setting options
Tap on the feature you need to disable. Tap the toggle switch to turn off the feature
Note: The steps outlined above are the most common steps. Do refer to your user guide if you encounter any difficulties or variations depending on your specific device model.

Title: How do I turn off live screen sharing or mirroring on my device? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/How_do_I_turn_off_live_screen_sharing_or_mirroring_on_my_device%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:29.264733

================================================================================

To turn off live screen sharing or mirroring on Android devices:
Swipe down from the top of the device screen twice to pull out the quick access function
Type â€˜Screen Castâ€™ or â€˜Smart View or â€˜Screen Mirrorâ€™ in the search bar ( Look for an icon that resembles a triangle inside 2 circular arrows or one that resembles a TV! Alternatively, tap on the gear icon on the top right corner of the quick access menu. Search for â€˜screen mirrorâ€™, â€˜screencastâ€™ or â€˜smart viewâ€™ in the search bar.)
Tap and hold the ScreenCast, ScreenMirror or Smart View button to call up the relevant menu with all available devices.
Disconnect devices by tapping on the device name.
To turn off live screen-sharing or mirroring on iOS devices:
Swipe down from the upper-right corner if your device has FaceID enabled or else swipe up from the bottom of your device if it is Touch ID enabled to open the Control Centre.
Tap on the â€˜Screen Mirroringâ€™ button (resembles two overlapping screens) .
Tap â€˜stop mirroringâ€™ on the device that you are mirroring to.
An added bonus! If you prefer to disable screen mirroring completely, follow these steps:
Tap on settings
Tap general
Tap automatically airPlay to TVs
Tap never
Note: The steps outlined above are the most common steps to turn off live screen sharing. Do refer to your user guide if you encounter any difficulties or variations depending on your specific device model.

================================================================================

Title: If there are suspected malware(s) on my device, how do I remove the malware(s)? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/If_there_are_suspected_malware(s)_on_my_device%2C_how_do_I_remove_the_malware(s)%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:32.215472

================================================================================

Your GXS Bank app will alert you when security vulnerabilities are detected.
To continue using your GXS Bank app, youâ€™ll need to remove these vulnerabilities.
Here are the steps to remove the identified apps
For Android phone users:
Tap and hold on the app icon.
Drag the app icon to the â€˜uninstallâ€™ section at the top of the screen.
If you donâ€™t see an â€˜uninstallâ€™ option, go to app infoâ€™ and tap on â€˜uninstallâ€™.
Tap OK when the uninstall confirmation pops up.
To remove the app from your settings :
Go to your phone's settings and tap apps.
Select the app you want to remove.
An option to disable or uninstall the app will appear at the bottom of the screen. Select the appropriate option and confirm the removal.
For Apple/iPhone users:
Tap and hold on the app icon in the home screen.
Tap â€˜remove appâ€™.
Select 'delete appâ€™.
To delete an app from the app library :
Touch and hold the app icon in the app library.
Tap â€˜delete appâ€™.
If you prefer to disable the remote access entirely, here are some steps
For Android phone users
Tap on settings
Select â€˜securityâ€™ or â€˜security & locationâ€™
Turn off the â€˜remote accessâ€™ option.
If the option for â€˜remote accessâ€™ is greyed out or unavailable, you may be using a third party security app that has remote access enabled. You can disable remote access from the settings of the identified third party app.
Note: The steps outlined above are the most common steps to remove malicious apps from devices. Do refer to your user guide if you encounter any difficulties or variations depending on your specific device model.
Re-launch the GXS Bank app after you have successfully removed the affected app(s). You are good to go!

Title: What are these security vulnerabilities? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/What_are_these_security_vulnerabilities%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:35.302528

================================================================================

From 1 December 2023, your access to the GXS Bank app will be blocked if the following are detected on your mobile device:
Known malware applications and jailbroken or rooted mobile devices.
Apps that are not from trusted or official app stores with accessibility service permission enabled on your devices.
When live screen sharing,Â screen mirroring or screen recording
is detected while the GXS Bank app is opened.
Apps that allow remote access to your device.

================================================================================

Title: What are â€˜Accessibilityâ€™ services and how do hackers exploit them? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/What_are_%E2%80%98Accessibility%E2%80%99_services_and_how_do_hackers_exploit_them%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:38.242520

================================================================================

Accessibility services are a feature offered on Android devices and is designed to assist users with disabilities or who are temporarily unable to fully interact with their device by allowing an additional and/or alternative interface feedback.
Apps that are not from trusted or official app stores with accessibility service permission enabled on your devices could allow hackers to tap this feature and gain access to your devices.
An app with these permissions enabled will have almost full control over the device. With the right accessibility permissions granted, the hacker can grant him or herself additional permissions and activate your deviceâ€™s camera and the microphone, capture screenshots, start screen recordings or live stream your screen. They will also be able to install and uninstall any app on your device.

================================================================================

Title: What data does GXS collect from these security measures? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/What_data_does_GXS_collect_from_these_security_measures%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:41.627620

================================================================================

We take your privacy seriously.
The enhanced security feature does not collect any additional personal data. Our enhanced security feature detects potential malware that might put your personal and banking information at risk and informs only you of the apps that could compromise your data.
We do not collect or store any information about the apps installed on your mobile device and how you are using them.

================================================================================

Title: What should I do to protect myself from malware? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/What_should_I_do_to_protect_myself_from_malware%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:44.920553

================================================================================

Here are some tips to protect yourself from malware!
Download apps from official or trusted app stores, such as Apple Store, Google Playstore, Samsung Galaxy Store, Huawei Store, Xiaomi Store, Amazon Store, Vivo Store or Oppo Store.
Install anti-virus software from reputable sources on your devices.
Always keep your applications (including your GXS Bank app) and devicesâ€™ operating systems updated.
Be vigilant and question if it is necessary for an app to ask for full control over your device or access to sensitive information that it does not need, before downloading it on your device.
Protect yourself from known scams!Â Download the Scamshield app which blocks and reports suspected scam calls and SMSes. The app is developed by the Singapore Police Force (SPF) and the National Crime Prevention Council (NCPC).
For IOS -
https://go.gov.sg/scamshield-ios
For Android -
https://go.gov.sg/scamshield-android

================================================================================

Title: When will the enhanced security measures take effect? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/When_will_the_enhanced_security_measures_take_effect%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:48.043870

================================================================================

We will be rolling out the enhanced security measures from 17 November 2023.
Here's a look at what's going to happen. From 17 to 30 November 2023, your GXS Bank app will alert you when potential security vulnerabilities are detected on your device. You are strongly encouraged to remove those vulnerabilities immediately to ensure that your device and data is safe. During this period, you will still be able to access your GXS Bank app at your own risk. Do note that in the case of confirmed malware being detected, you will need to remove those malicious apps to proceed.
But from 1 December 2023 onwards, if security vulnerabilities remain detected on your device, you will no longer be able to access your GXS Bank app.
To ensure you have the latest security measures, always update your GXS Bank app to the latest version!

================================================================================

Title: Why is GXS restricting access to the GXS app? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Emergencies/Malware_Threats/Why_is_GXS_restricting_access_to_the_GXS_app%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:09:50.885419

================================================================================

We are joining arms with other banks in Singapore to protect you from potential malware threats.
Malware installed on your device can potentially steal your personal information and take control of your device to make fraudulent banking transactions without your consent. This is why, access to your GXS Bank app is being restricted, when security vulnerabilities are detected.

================================================================================

Title: How do I apply for a GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Open_a_GXS_Savings_Account/How_do_I_apply_for_a_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:00.329953

================================================================================

*Thank you for your support!
Simply download the GXS Bank app from Apple Store or Google Play store. Launch the app, and tap on GXS Savings Account â€˜Sign up nowâ€™. We will guide you the rest of the way.
You'll need to:
Be at least 16 years old,
Have a residential address in Singapore,
Be a Singapore citizen, Singapore Permanent Resident or have a valid visa e.g. Dependantâ€™s Pass (DP), Employment Pass (EP), Work Permit, and
Have a Singpass Myinfo account.
Not hold an existing GXS Biz Account and/or GXS FlexiLoan Biz
Note - we currently do not accept applications from US citizens.If we require additional documents, we will email you or send you a notification on the GXS Bank app.
Your GXS Savings Account will be opened shortly after your documents have been reviewed and approved. We would like to share that your deposits with GXS bank are aggregated and insured up to S$100,000 by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC).
If you require assistance on yourÂ Singpass access, you may contact
Singpass Helpdesk
directly.

Title: What is in my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Open_a_GXS_Savings_Account/What_is_in_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:24.654136

================================================================================

Your GXS Savings Account is made up of your Main Account, Saving Pocket(s) and Boost Pocket, which can be added to the home screen of your GXS Bank app.
Your Main Account is for your regular transactions, and you can create up to 8 Saving Pockets for your saving goals. Just remember that you can only transfer funds from your Saving Pockets to and from your Main Account.
You may also lock your funds away in a Boost Pocket to earn base + bonus interest rates.
If you need to use your funds urgently, you can close your Boost Pocket before the lock-in period is over, earn the base interest to date and forfeit the bonus interest. You will need to fund your Boost Pocket from your Main Account during creation, and the funds from your Boost Pocket will return to your Main Account upon closure.

================================================================================

Title: Why wasnâ€™t my application for a GXS Savings Account approved immediately? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Open_a_GXS_Savings_Account/Why_wasn%E2%80%99t_my_application_for_a_GXS_Savings_Account_approved_immediately%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:27.835827

================================================================================

Trust us, we donâ€™t like to keep you waiting. Our approvals are typically instant forÂ applications that satisfy our eligibility criteria (which includes prevailing laws, regulations, and our policies).Â If we need more information to approve your application, weâ€™ll send you an email or a push notification.

================================================================================

Title: How is daily interest calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Interest_and_Fees/How_is_daily_interest_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:34.142917

================================================================================

You earn interest daily based on the aggregate balance of your Main Account and Saving Pocket(s) at the end of each day. Interest earned on the balance for each Saving Pocket is 1.18% p.a., and 1.08% p.a. for your Main Account. We multiply your balance by the interest rate per annum over 365 days. Interest will be credited to your account when you earn at least S$0.01 in accumulated interest.
For example, based on an interest rate of 1.18% p.a. applicable on balances in your Saving Pockets,
On 30 July 2025, your balance in your Saving Pocket(s) is S$20,000. You will earn an accrued interest of S$0.64657.
S$0.64 will be credited to your account on the morning of 31 July 2025. Your balance will then be S$20,000.64. The remaining S$0.00657 will continue to accrue the next day.

================================================================================

Title: Will I earn interest when my deposit amount reaches the maximum balance amount? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Interest_and_Fees/Will_I_earn_interest_when_my_deposit_amount_reaches_the_maximum_balance_amount%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:39.973339

================================================================================

Definitely! The funds in your GXS Savings Account will continue to earn interest even after youâ€™ve hit your maximum balance amount.
Here is an example, based on an interest rate of 1.08% per annum:
On 20Â June 2025, your balance in your Saving Pocket(s) is S$95,000 at the end of the day. You will earn an interest of S$2.81Â and it will be credited to your account on 21 JuneÂ 2025. Your account balance on 21Â June 2025Â is now S$95,002.81. You will continue to earn interest based on this S$95,002.81Â amount at the end of the day.
For your information, your deposits with GXS are aggregated and insured up to S$100,000 by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC).

================================================================================

Title: Are the interest rates different for my Main Account and Saving Pockets? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Saving_Pockets/Are_the_interest_rates_different_for_my_Main_Account_and_Saving_Pockets%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:42.971019

================================================================================

Yes, with Saving Pockets, our interest rate of 1.18% p.a. takes you closer to your next great adventure or brand new phone. The interest rate for your Main Account is 1.08% p.a.

================================================================================

Title: Can I use an external bank account to fund my Saving Pockets? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Saving_Pockets/Can_I_use_an_external_bank_account_to_fund_my_Saving_Pockets%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:10:45.734040

================================================================================

You can't top up your Saving Pockets with an external bank account. What you can do is fund your GXS Savings Account with an external bank account, and then use those funds to add to your Saving Pockets. Tada! One step closer to your saving goals.

Title: How can I track the performance of my Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre

Title: How do I apply for or sign up for Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/How_do_I_apply_for_or_sign_up_for_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:10.779594

================================================================================

No sign-up is necessary!
If you have a GXS Savings Account, simply log in to your GXS Bank app, create a new savings pocket and select the 'Boost Pocket' option. Follow the prompts to fund your Boost Pocket and start earning higher interest rates!

================================================================================

Title: How is interest for a Boost Pocket calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/How_is_interest_for_a_Boost_Pocket_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:13.558416

================================================================================

The base interest for a Boost Pocket is calculated on each day end balance. The interest is accrued and credited daily.
The bonus interest is calculated on the principal amount and will be credited only at the end of the tenure.

================================================================================

Title: How long can I keep my funds in a Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/How_long_can_I_keep_my_funds_in_a_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:16.370221

================================================================================

You can keep funds in your Boost Pocket for a fixed tenure of either 1, 3, 8 or 12 months.
Itâ€™s a fuss-free way to save!

================================================================================

Title: How much can I place in a Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/How_much_can_I_place_in_a_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:22.762352

================================================================================

You can place up to S$85,000 across 3 Boost Pockets, subject to a minimum of S$100 per Boost Pocket.
Example 1
Boost Pocket 1 - S$85,000
Example 2
Boost Pocket 1 - S$100
Boost Pocket 2 - S$1,000
Boost Pocket 3 - S$83,900

================================================================================

Title: What are the maturity instructions available for my Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_are_the_maturity_instructions_available_for_my_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:25.629553

================================================================================

Prior to funding your Boost Pocket, you can choose to either:
return the funds to your Main Account, or
renew the Boost Pocket (including base and bonus interest earned) for another term upon maturity
The choice is yours!
Changed your mind? Not to worry. You can make changes to the maturity instructions at any time before your Boost Pocket matures.

================================================================================

Title: What happens if I withdraw funds from my Boost Pocket before it matures? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_happens_if_I_withdraw_funds_from_my_Boost_Pocket_before_it_matures%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:28.416343

================================================================================

If you withdraw your funds from your Boost Pocket before the maturity date, all bonus interest that you could have earned will be forfeited. Your Boost Pocket will also be closed.
In order to maximise your earnings, it's best to keep your funds in your Boost Pocket until maturity.

================================================================================

Title: What happens to my Boost Pocket if I close my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_happens_to_my_Boost_Pocket_if_I_close_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:31.183107

================================================================================

Closure of your GXS Savings Account will result in the closure of your Boost Pocket too.
Prior to closure of your GXS Savings Account, you will have to withdraw all funds first (Closure of your account can only happen when there is zero balance).
Proceed to close your Boost Pocket first, and then on to your GXS Savings Account.
Pro tip: It's best to keep your funds in the Boost Pocket until the end of the tenure to maximise your earning!

================================================================================

Title: What happens to my existing Boost Pocket when interest rates change? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_happens_to_my_existing_Boost_Pocket_when_interest_rates_change%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:34.386277

================================================================================

The interest rates for your existing Boost Pockets remain locked for the placement period. If your Boost Pocket is set to auto-renew, the new prevailing interest rates at the time of maturity will apply upon renewal.
If your Boost Pocket is not set to auto-renew, your Boost Pocket funds will then be moved to the Main Account of your GXS Savings Account upon maturity. The Boost Pocket will then be closed.

================================================================================

Title: What interest do I earn for funds in my Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_interest_do_I_earn_for_funds_in_my_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:37.407867

================================================================================

Boost Pocket offers a bonus interest on top of a base interest. Here are the rates:
Base interest:
1.08% p.a.
Bonus interest:
0.3% p.a. for 3 months
0.22% p.a. for 1, 8 or 12 months
This gives your Boost Pocket a total interest rate of:
1.38% p.a. for the 3 months tenure
1.30% p.a. for the 1, 8 or 12 months tenure
Best of all, the Boost Pocket interest rate remains locked in for the entire tenure!

================================================================================

Title: What is Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_is_Boost_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:40.741181

================================================================================

Boost Pocket is a type of pocket that enables you to deposit a specific amount of money for a fixed tenure of either 1, 3, 8 or 12 months. Your funds earn a base interest that's credited daily and a bonus interest credited at the end of the chosen tenure.

================================================================================

Title: What is the difference between a Boost Pocket and a Saving Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/What_is_the_difference_between_a_Boost_Pocket_and_a_Saving_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:43.671168

================================================================================

The Boost Pocket and Saving Pocket are both features of the GXS Savings Account.
A Boost Pocket offers a higher interest rate for a fixed tenure, whereas a Saving Pocket provides more withdrawal flexibility at lower interest rates and no fixed tenure.

================================================================================

Title: Why am I not able to close my Boost Pocket at certain times of the day? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Boost_Pocket/Why_am_I_not_able_to_close_my_Boost_Pocket_at_certain_times_of_the_day%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:46.986582

================================================================================

Due to service maintenance, closure of Boost Pockets will not be available from 11:45pm to 2:00am daily. We seek your understanding to try again outside these timings.
Do note as well, that if you had previously requested to withdraw your Boost Pocket funds upon maturity, or did not instruct us to renew your Boost Pocket, the money will be credited to your Main Account after 2:00am of the maturity date.

================================================================================

Title: Are my deposits with GXS protected or insured? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Fund_Account/Are_my_deposits_with_GXS_protected_or_insured%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:49.998365

================================================================================

Your deposits in your GXS Savings Account are insured up to S$100,000 by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation (SDIC), under the Deposit Insurance Scheme. Here's a description of the scheme:
Singapore dollar deposits of non-bank depositors are insured by the Singapore Deposit Insurance Corporation, for up to S$100,000 in aggregate per depositor per Scheme member by law. Foreign currency deposits, dual currency investments, structured deposits and other investment products are not insured.

================================================================================

Title: How can I withdraw cash from my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Fund_Account/How_can_I_withdraw_cash_from_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:52.804872

================================================================================

GXS is a digital-only bank, hence we do not offer local nor overseas cash withdrawal services.

================================================================================

Title: How do I fund my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Fund_Account/How_do_I_fund_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:55.725121

================================================================================

You may fund your GXS Savings Account via the following methods:
1) Via PayNow:
a) If youâ€™ve linked your GXS Savings Account with PayNow, you can input your NRIC or phone number in another bank account's details to transfer money to your GXS Savings Account.
b) If you haven't linked your GXS Savings Account with PayNow,
Go to 'Me'
Under 'My account', click 'Manage PayNow'
Register for PayNow with your NRIC or phone number
Enter a PayNow nickname. This is what others will see when they search for you via NRIC/phone number
Click 'Confirm' and your registration is complete!
You may now transfer funds to your GXS Savings Account from another bank account (see 1a)
2) Via FAST:
On the GXS homescreen, tap 'Add money'.
Youâ€™ll see your GXS beneficiary name, account number, bank name, bank code, and branch code
Log in to the bank account you wish to transfer money from, to fund your GXS Savings Account
Input your GXS Savings Account's details in another bank account's details to transfer money to your GXS Savings Account
3)Â Via Inter-bank GIRO:
On the GXS homescreen, tap 'Add money'.
Youâ€™ll see your GXS beneficiary name, account number, bank name, bank code, and branch code
Log in to the bank account you wish to transfer money from, to fund your GXS Savings Account and choose GIRO as an option
Input your GXS Savings Account's details in another bank account's PayNow details to transfer money to your GXS Savings Account
(Note: At the moment, we do not support the receipt of funds via Telegraphic Transfer, Cheque and Non-FAST transactions such as MEPS.)

================================================================================

Title: How do I transfer funds to and from my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Fund_Account/How_do_I_transfer_funds_to_and_from_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:11:58.983833

================================================================================

Here are several ways to transfer funds to and from your GXS Savings Account:
You can send funds via:
FAST
PayNow
Intrabank (applies to GXS Savings Account only)
You can receive funds via:
FAST
Inter-bank GIRO
PayNow (you must register your GXS Savings Account for PayNow to be eligible)
At the moment, GXS Savings Account is not able to send or receive funds via the following methods: Telegraphic Transfer, Cheque and Non-FAST transactions such as MEPS.

================================================================================

Title: Is there a maximum amount I can deposit in my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Fund_Account/Is_there_a_maximum_amount_I_can_deposit_in_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:02.406290

================================================================================

You can deposit up to the maximum balance amount into your GXS Savings Account, which consists of your Main Account and Pocket(s). This maximum balance amount may vary for different customers,Â and can be upÂ to S$95,000.
Follow these simple steps to find out this maximum balance amount for your GXS Savings Account:
Tap on the 3 dots next to your â€˜GXS SAVINGS ACCOUNT'.
Followed by â€˜View balance infoâ€™.
For example, if your maximum balance amount is S$20,000, and you already have S$19,500 in your account. Then you deposit S$500 to bring your balance up to S$20,000. This means you'll be unable to add more funds to your account.
Do note that you will continue to earn interest even if your account balance reaches the maximum balance amount.

================================================================================

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:05.208343

Your account balance is shown on your home screen and in your transaction history screen. You can view your transaction history by clicking on the 'Main account'Â or 'Saving pockets'Â on the home screen.

Title: How do I manage an account for a customer lacking mental capacity if Iâ€™ve been appointed as a donee under a lasting power of attorney, or as a deputy under a court order? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Manage_Account/How_do_I_manage_an_account_for_a_customer_lacking_mental_capacity_if_I%E2%80%99ve_been_appointed_as_a_donee_under_a_lasting_power_of_attorney%2C_or_as_a_deputy_under_a_court_order%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:11.352871

================================================================================

Youâ€™ll need to submit supporting documents in this process. Itâ€™s potentially complex, so please reach out to us for guidance:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat (recommended)
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: Submit an enquiry
GXS Hotline:Â 1800 866 6685Â or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)
GXS Customer Support Email:
help@gxs.com.sg
In general, you will be asked to provide supporting documents to us via email or mail.
Do note, all documents that are copies of the original documents will need to be certified true copies by any of the following:
Notary Public
Practising Advocate & Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Singapore
Documents Required as Proxy Decision Makers via Lasting Power of Attorney
If you are the Donee appointed via a Lasting Power of Attorney to act on behalf of Donor who lacks mental capacity, please submit the following documents to us:
Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) document
Medical Report for the activation of LPA (dated within the last 6 months)
Original identity document(s) of Donee and Donor
Latest bank statement (dated within the last 3 months) of Deputyship/other bank account in the name of Donor
Documents Required as Proxy Decision Makers via Court Order
If you are the court-appointed Deputy to act on behalf of the individual who lacks mental capacity, please submit the following documents for the account closure.
Court Order appointing Deputy, made pursuant to the Mental Capacity Act
Original identity document(s) of Deputy and individual lacking mental capacity
Latest bank statement (dated within the last 3 months) of Deputyship/other bank account in the name of individual who lacks mental capacity.
Submission of Documents
You may submit a digital copy of the required documents to us at
GXS Customer Support Email: help@gxs.com.sg
The physical copies of the documents will need to be sent to the bank at:
Attention: GXS Operations
GXS Bank Pte. Ltd.
3 Media Close
#09-03, Grab HQ @ One-North
Singapore 138498
After Submission of Documents
Funds can only be released upon our receipt of the required digital and physical documents.
After processing the documents, we will proceed to close the account and transfer any remaining balance to:
the Deputyship/Lasting Power of Attorney account in the name of individual who loses mental capacity or in the absence of this,
other bank account in the name of the individual who lacks mental capacity.

Click 'Notifications and emails'.
Toggle on to receive notifications from us :)

Title: Is my bank transfer limit a daily or monthly limit? - GXS Help Centre

Your bank transfer limit is the daily limit for all transactions. This includes FAST payments and transfers to both GXS and non-GXS bank accounts. You may change the limit within your GXS Bank app.

Title: My loved one has passed. How can I manage their account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Manage_Account/My_loved_one_has_passed._How_can_I_manage_their_account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:35.656284

================================================================================

Losing a loved one is not easy. Please reach out to us for guidance on how to manageÂ your loved oneâ€™s GXS account. These are the steps you can take:
Apply for the legal documents to manage their account
Request for their asset information (optional)
Request to close their account
Getting the right legal documents depends on whether your loved one has left a will
If your loved one has left a will, and you are appointed in the will as the Executor of the estate, apply for a Grant of Probate.
If you are not able to find a will, or you know that your loved one has not left a will, apply for a Grant of Letters of Administration. You may wish to engage a lawyer to help you with the application.
Both Grants are court orders that will allow for the administration of your loved oneâ€™s estate.
For an estate worth under S$3 million, you can apply to the Family Justice Court. For an estate worth over S$3 million, apply to the Family Division of the High Court.
If your loved oneâ€™s estate is worth less than S$50,000, with or without a will, you may consider applying to the Public Trustee. The Public Trusteeâ€™s Office may assist with the distribution of the assets without a Grant.
To request for your kinâ€™s asset information, please submit these documents to us:
Digital death certificate from the My Legacy portal
Identity document of notifier or personal representative
Proof of relationship (e.g. marriage certificate, birth certificate)
Originating Summons for Grant of Probate or Grant of Letters of Administration
To close your loved oneâ€™s account, please submit the following:
Death certificate of your loved one (e.g. digital death certificate from the My Legacy portal)
Grant of Probate or Grant of Letters of Administration
Identity document of Executor or Administrator of the estate, as named in the Grant
Proof of bank account details (to release the kinâ€™s funds)
Note: If you are submitting copies of original documents, please ensure that the copies are certified true copies of original documents by a Notary Public or a practising Advocate & Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Singapore.
You can submit digital copies to:
GXS Customer Support Email: help@gxs.com.sg
Or send physical copies to GXS at:
GXS Bank Pte. Ltd.
3 Media Close
#09-03, Grab HQ @ One-North
Singapore 138498

================================================================================

Title: What will happen to my GXS Savings Account if I am declared bankrupt? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Manage_Account/What_will_happen_to_my_GXS_Savings_Account_if_I_am_declared_bankrupt%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:38.645402

================================================================================

The Official Assignee will notify us to close your GXS Savings Account. We will transfer any leftover funds to the Official Assignee as well.

================================================================================

Title: Whatâ€™s the difference between total balance and available balance? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Manage_Account/What%E2%80%99s_the_difference_between_total_balance_and_available_balance%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:41.458571

================================================================================

Your total balance includes both your available balance and earmarked balance.
The available balance is the amount you have access to. You can use this money for transactions such as spending, withdrawal, and transfers.
The earmarked balance refers to funds that are still processing or on hold, and cannot be used. Payments canâ€™t be made with your earmarked funds.

================================================================================

Title: Apart from my GXS bank statement, how can I view the interest earned from my GXS Savings Account, Saving Pockets and Boost Pocket? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:44.337154

================================================================================

Viewing your earned interest is easy!
Just log in to the GXS Bank app and under your GXS Savings Account, just tap on either Main Account, Saving Pocket or Boost Pocket.

================================================================================

Title: Are GXS e-statements considered certified or authorised statements? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Account_Statements/Are_GXS_e-statements_considered_certified_or_authorised_statements%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:47.200072

================================================================================

The e-statements available in your GXS Bank app are soft copies of your account statements, which you can print if needed. They will not have a signature since they are system generated documents, and are not certified true copies.

Title: Are Saving Pockets and Boost Pocket reflected on my GXS Bank e-statements? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Account_Statements/Are_Saving_Pockets_and_Boost_Pocket_reflected_on_my_GXS_Bank_e-statements%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:12:50.463174

================================================================================

Saving Pocket(s) will be reflected on your GXS Bank e-statement if you've added or removed money from them. They will appear even if you've deleted any Saving Pocket within the month. If there is no balance in the Saving Pocket, it will not show up on your statement.
The Boost Pocket will be reflected on your GXS Bank e-statement once youâ€™ve created one. You will be able to see the base interest and bonus interest earned and credited to the Boost Pocket.

Title: How do I close my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:24.099884

================================================================================

Weâ€™re sad to see you go. Before closing your GXS Savings Account, please close your Saving Pocket(s) if you've created any, and transfer any remaining account balance to another bank account. Any recurring payments arrangements will cease once your account is closed. Additionally, you will not be able to reinstate or reapply for a GXS Savings Account once you've closed your account.
We also encourage you to download all/any monthly statements as you may no longer be able to access the GXS Bank app once your account is closed.
Once you've done this, reach out to us to close your GXS Savings Account via:
GXS Bank app, Help Centre: GXS Chat (recommended)
GXS Hotline:Â 1800 866 6685Â or (+65) 6866 6685 (from overseas)

Title: Can I release part of the funds that I have locked under Money Lock? - GXS Help Centre

Title: Can Money Lock feature be used to secure all funds in my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/Can_Money_Lock_feature_be_used_to_secure_all_funds_in_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:39.568760

================================================================================

At the moment, only funds in your Saving Pocket(s) can be locked.
To lock your funds, simply create a new Saving Pocket or add more money to an existing locked Saving Pocket from your Main Account. Hereâ€™s how:
Create a new Saving Pocket
1. Log in to GXS Bank app.
2. Tap on â€˜Pockets'.
3. Under 'Create Pocket', select â€˜Saving Pocket'.
4. Tap on 'Create Nowâ€™ and follow the guided instructions.
5. Once you have confirmed and created the Saving Pocket amount, tap on â€˜Settingsâ€™.
6. Tap on â€˜Enable Money Lockâ€™ and select â€˜Confirmâ€™ to proceed.
Add funds to an existing Saving Pocket
1. Log in to GXS Bank app.
2. Tap on your Saving Pocket.
3. Tap on â€˜+ Fundâ€™.
4. Key in the amount you would like to add.
5. Once you confirm, you will see the following message â€˜Your newly added funds will be lockedâ€™.
You will receive a push and email Â notification once the lock is successful.
Do note that the lock is immediate, and unlocking the Money Lock feature will require a successful video verification.

================================================================================

Title: How much funds can I lock with Money Lock? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/How_much_funds_can_I_lock_with_Money_Lock%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:42.581874

================================================================================

Currently, the Money Lock feature can only be applied to your Saving Pocket(s).
There is no specific limit on the amount you can lock; you have the flexibility to transfer some or all of your funds from your Main Account to your Saving Pocket and then lock it. Do note that the maximum balance of S$95,000 for your GXS Savings Account still applies.
You can also choose to lock some or all of your Saving Pockets.

================================================================================

Title: Is it mandatory for me to use Money Lock on my GXS Bank accounts? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/Is_it_mandatory_for_me_to_use_Money_Lock_on_my_GXS_Bank_accounts%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:45.466483

================================================================================

No, but by using the Money Lock feature, you add an extra layer of protection to your funds.

================================================================================

Title: I need my funds urgently. How can I unlock the funds in my Savings Pocket? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/I_need_my_funds_urgently._How_can_I_unlock_the_funds_in_my_Savings_Pocket%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:48.314120

================================================================================

The purpose of Money Lock is to secure your funds and add an additional layer of security to prevent cybercrimes.
If you're really in need of your funds, you can put in a request with our Customer Support Team to unlock them. They will require a video verification from you. Hereâ€™s how to do it:
Step 1: Contact our support team
Reach out to us via call at (+65) 6866 6685 or in-app chat.
Step 2: Verify your identity
To ensure the security of your funds, we require a video verification process. Our support team will arrange a call via Zoom where you will need to verify your identity. Do have your NRIC/FIN ready for this process.
Step 3: Unlocking your funds
Upon successful verification, your funds will be unlocked within 1 day. We will notify you once the process is complete and your funds are available for use.

================================================================================

Title: What is Money Lock? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/What_is_Money_Lock%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:51.176256

================================================================================

Money Lock is the latest anti-scam feature designed to enhance cybersecurity for GXS Bank customers by allowing you to â€˜lockâ€™ a portion of your funds in your GXS Savings Account.
This feature provides an additional layer of security and control over your finances.

================================================================================

Title: What is the benefit of using GXS Bank Money Lock? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Savings_Account/Money_Lock/What_is_the_benefit_of_using_GXS_Bank_Money_Lock%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:54.431963

================================================================================

Scammers and cybercriminals often use tactics like phishing, malware attacks, and social engineering to gain unauthorised access to your accounts.
By using the Money Lock feature, you add an extra layer of protection to your funds.

================================================================================

Title: Will funds that I have locked under Money Lock earn interest? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:13:57.775668

Of course! Funds in your Saving Pocket(s) â€“ locked or unlocked, will continue to earn interest.

Be a Singapore Citizen or a Singapore Permanent Resident; and
Have a minimum annual income of S$20,000
Not hold an existing GXS FlexiCard and/or GXS Biz Account and/or GXS FlexiLoan Biz
Do note that all GXS FlexiLoan applications go through an evaluation process which is aligned with our internal requirements. This process includes an assessment of the applicantâ€™s credit profile and eligibility - for example: Individuals currently under a Debt Consolidation Plan (DCP) or Debt Repayment Scheme (DRS) will not be eligible to apply.
For Grab users, including Grab drivers and delivery partners, your transactions and earnings may be relevant for credit assessments and could be shared between Grab and GXS Bank for these purposes.

Title: What can I use my GXS FlexiLoan for? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiLoan/What_can_I_use_my_GXS_FlexiLoan_for%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:18.996944

================================================================================

GXS FlexiLoan is a credit line that allows you to borrow up to 10 loans from your available credit limit. No interest nor fees will be charged if you do not borrow a loan from the credit line.
Based on your needs, there are 2 types of loans you can take:
InstalmentÂ Loan
If you prefer to manage your budget with equal monthly payments over a longer period, then this is the loan for you.
Select a loan tenure of 2 - 60 months (as assigned by the bank)
Interest from as low as 2.88% p.a. (EIR 5.45% p.a.) or any rate assigned by the bank. No fees at all!
Repay early and enjoy interest savings
Possible uses: Support your financial goals, business needs, renovation, education, managing multiple outstanding balances with a single facility etc.
Balance Transfer
Conserve cash by making smaller repayments each month over a shorter period. Minimum monthly repayment could be as low as 1% of your loan principal (or at such other rate as stipulated by the bank)
Select a loan tenure of 4 - 12 months (as assigned by the bank) and repay the remaining outstanding only at the end of the loan tenure
Enjoy 0% interest with a one-time processing fee (EIR 4.13% p.a.)
Do note that you can takeÂ a Balance Transfer only once, unless otherwise allocated by the bank.
Possible uses: Support your financial goals, emergencies, short-term business cash-flow cycles, managing multiple outstanding balances with a single facility etc.
*Effective Interest Rate (EIR) for Instalment Loan is calculated based on an average loan amount of S$10,000 with a 24-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 to 1 Jan 2026. EIR for Balance Transfer is calculated with an average loan amount of $10,000, with a 4-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 and a minimum monthly due of 1% of loan principal.

================================================================================

We'll reach out if there's anything else we need from you.

Singpass Helpdesk
directly.

Title: What is GXS FlexiLoan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiLoan/What_is_GXS_FlexiLoan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:24.962888

================================================================================

When you apply for a GXS FlexiLoan, you getÂ access to a standby credit line from which you can borrow loans.
What is a standby credit line?
You have the flexibility to borrow a loan from the credit line only when you need it
No interest or fees will be charged if you do not borrow from the credit line
You can borrow multiple loans up to your credit limit
What are the great things about GXS FlexiLoan?
There are 2 types of loans you can take based on your needs -Â Instalment Loan with interest rates from 2.88% p.a. (EIR 5.45% p.a.) or a 0% interest Balance Transfer with a one-time processing fee (EIR 4.13% p.a.) where allocated
You can get cash instantly 24/7
Before borrowingÂ a loan, all interest rates and fees are clearly displayed to you so you can make the best choice
Flexibility to select a monthly repayment date that works for you
No early repayment fees
No annual fees
No late fees, but a late interest is chargeable if you do not make your loan repayments on time
You can borrow up to 10 loans from your available credit limit
* Effective Interest Rate (EIR) for Instalment Loan is calculated based on an average loan amount of S$10,000 with a 24-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 to 1 Jan 2026. EIR for Balance Transfer is calculated with an average loan amount of $10,000, with a 4-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 and a minimum monthly due of 1% of loan principal.

Title: What is the difference between Instalment Loan and Balance Transfer? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiLoan/What_is_the_difference_between_Instalment_Loan_and_Balance_Transfer%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:28.254820

================================================================================

Instalment Loan and Balance Transfer are different types of loans that you can borrowÂ from GXS FlexiLoan.
InstalmentÂ Loan
If you prefer to manage your budget with equal monthly payments over a longer period, then this is the loan for you.
Select a loan tenure of 2 - 60 months (as assigned by the bank)
Interest from as low as 2.88% p.a. (EIR 5.45% p.a.) or any rate assigned by the bank. No fees at all!
Repay early and enjoy interest savings
Possible uses: Support your financial goals, business needs, renovation, education, managing multiple outstanding balances with a single facility etc.
Balance Transfer
Conserve cash by making smaller repayments each month over a shorter period. Minimum monthly repayment could be as low as 1% of your loan principal (or at such other rate as stipulated by the bank).
Select a loan tenure of 4 - 12 months (as assigned by the bank) and repay the remaining outstanding only at the end of the tenure
Enjoy 0% interest with a one-time processing fee (EIR 4.13% p.a.)
Do note that you can take a Balance Transfer only once, unless otherwise allocated by the bank.
Possible uses: Support your financial goals, emergencies, short-term business cash-flow cycles, managing multiple outstanding balances with a single facility etc.
*Effective Interest Rate (EIR) for Instalment Loan is calculated based on an average loan amount of S$10,000 with a 24-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 to 1 Jan 2026. EIR for Balance Transfer is calculated with an average loan amount of $10,000, with a 4-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 and a minimum monthly due of 1% of loan principal.

Title: How do I change my GXS FlexiLoan credit limit? - GXS Help Centre

Title: How do I close my GXS FlexiLoan account? - GXS Help Centre

On the GXS FlexiLoan home screen, tap on 'Manage'.
Select 'Close Account'.
Click 'Done'.
Your GXS FlexiLoan account will be closed.

Title: What is Balance-To-Income (BTI) and how does it affect me? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Manage_GXS_FlexiLoan_Account/What_is_Balance-To-Income_(BTI)_and_how_does_it_affect_me%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:51.981469

================================================================================

The regulatory requirements has placed a borrowing limit on the amount of unsecured credit that can be granted to borrowers across all banks in Singapore.
This is to ensure that borrowers do not take up too much debt beyond their means to repay.
What is the borrowing limit on unsecured credit?
This limit is defined as Balance-To-Income (BTI) ratio. BTI ratio is calculated by taking your total unsecured interest-bearing outstanding balances across all financial institutions or corporations related to financial institutions in Singapore and dividing it by your monthly income. The industry-wide borrowing limit is currently set at 12x of monthly income and is applicable to borrowers with annual income less than S$120,000.
What does my total unsecured interest-bearing outstanding debt include?
Total outstanding debt includes debt across all financial institutions and corporations related to financial institutions. For purposes of calculating your BTI ratio, only interest-bearing unsecured debt needs to be included.
This includes not only your outstanding balance on GXS unsecured lending products (e.g. GXS FlexiLoan) but also your interest-bearing outstanding balance with other financial institutions. Examples of interest-bearing outstanding balances could be amounts charged to credit cards that are not repaid in full by the due date, interest accruing unsecured personal loans or credit lines, or late interest on an otherwise interest-free loan. If you have a Grab Partner Cash Advance (PCA) loan, the outstanding balances are included as well.
If your BTI ratio exceeds 12x of your monthly income for 3 consecutive months, your GXS FlexiLoan account will be suspended from further borrowings. At the moment, you will not be able to unblock your account once it is suspended.

================================================================================

Title: Where can I view the loan details of my GXS FlexiLoan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Manage_GXS_FlexiLoan_Account/Where_can_I_view_the_loan_details_of_my_GXS_FlexiLoan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:55.071835

================================================================================

If you have active loan(s), youâ€™ll also be able to view your monthly instalment(s) amount, upcoming due date, number of instalments paid/remaining, and the remaining amount(s) you have left to pay on your loan(s).

Title: Can I borrow more than one Instalment Loan from my GXS FlexiLoan credit line? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_an_Instalment_Loan/Can_I_borrow_more_than_one_Instalment_Loan_from_my_GXS_FlexiLoan_credit_line%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:14:58.087573

================================================================================

Yes, of course! GXS FlexiLoan is designed in a way that grants you the flexibility to structure your loans however and whenever you need them.
In combination with Balance Transfer, you can borrow up to 10 loans at any one point in time from your available credit limit instantly, with no additional checks or approvals.
This means that if you have already taken 1 Balance Transfer, you may only borrow up to 9 more Instalment Loans.
You'll have the flexibility to customize the loan amount, tenure and loan name of each loan.

Title: How do I borrow an Instalment Loan from my GXS FlexiLoan credit line? - GXS Help Centre

Here are the steps to borrowÂ an Instalment Loan:

Key in the amount you need.
Select the tenure of your loan.

Name your loan (to indicate its purpose!).
Select where youâ€™d like to transfer your loan to.
Review the transfer details and click 'Confirm'.
However, before borrowing an Instalment Loan, you'll need to have a third-party bank account linked to your PayNow, via mobile number and/or NRIC. You can choose to transfer funds into a third-party bank account via PayNow held in your own name.

Title: How do I calculate the monthly repayment amount of my Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_an_Instalment_Loan/How_do_I_calculate_the_monthly_repayment_amount_of_my_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:04.104772

================================================================================

The interest payable component forms part of your Equal Monthly Instalment (EMI) amount, which is reflected in-app in your repayment schedule. For example,
Annual Percentage Rate (APR): 3% p.a.
Effective Interest Rate (EIR): 5.69% p.a.
Tenure: 3 years
Borrowed loan amount: S$10,000
Total interest payable = Loan * APR * tenure
= S$10,000 * 3% / 365 * (365 * 3 years)
= S$900
EMI amount = (interest payable + principal) / tenure
= (S$900 + S$10,000) / 36 months
= S$302.78
Your monthly repayment amount over the 3 year tenure will therefore be S$302.78.
*The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the total borrowing cost, expressed as a yearly rate, relative to the initial loan amount.
The Effective Interest Rate (EIR) is the rate that reflects the true cost of borrowing and takes into account total charges. It's computed over a reducing balance basis and accrued daily.

================================================================================

Title: What's the minimum/maximum Instalment Loan amount I can borrow from my GXS FlexiLoan credit line? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_an_Instalment_Loan/What's_the_minimum%2F%2Fmaximum_Instalment_Loan_amount_I_can_borrow_from_my_GXS_FlexiLoan_credit_line%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:07.414524

================================================================================

The minimum instalment loan amount you can borrowÂ from your available limit is S$200, while the maximum is capped at your total available credit limit.
Do note that even though you may have an available credit limit, you cannot borrow more loans if you currently have 10 loans that are not fully repaid.

Title: Why canâ€™t I take an Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre

Insufficient credit limit: You do not have sufficient credit limit to borrow a loan.
Borrowing of a loan is in progress: You may have a loanÂ that is pending
Balance-To-Income (BTI): Your total interest-bearing outstanding balance on all unsecured credit facilities across all banks in Singapore exceeds the industry-wide borrowing limit for 3 consecutive months. To find out more about BTI, refer
here
.
60 days past due: Any one of your loan was unpaid for 60 days past the due date.
The bank reserves the right to suspend the borrowing of loans for any other reasons.
