Do note that the above applies to both Instalment Loans and Balance Transfer loans. However, as you can currently only takeÂ a Balance Transfer loan once, please note that once you have repaid it in full, you will not be able to takeÂ another Balance Transfer loan.

Title: Can I overpay my monthly repayment amount? - GXS Help Centre

Title: Can I repay my monthly repayment amount early? - GXS Help Centre

We recommend taking out a loan only when necessary and with careful consideration. The GXS FlexiLoan product is designed to provide flexibility and support during unexpected situations. The bank conducts periodic reviews to ensure that our customers are using our products responsibly and with prudence.

Title: How do I make my monthly repayments? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_Repayment/How_do_I_make_my_monthly_repayments%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:28.382528

================================================================================

Making your monthly repayments can be done on the GXS Bank app via the following method(s):
Using your GXS Savings Account to repay:
On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, select the loan you'd like to repay (located at the bottom of the screen).
Select the amount you'd like to repay. You can choose between:
Entering an amount of your choice;
The monthly amount payable option; or
The full repayment option.
3. Select to repay with 'GXS Savings Account'.
4. Review your repayment details and click 'Confirm & Pay'.
Using a third-party bank account to repay:
On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, select the loan you'd like to repay (located at the bottom of the screen).
Select the amount you'd like to repay. You can choose between:
Entering an amount of your choice;
The monthly amount payable option; or
The full repayment option.
3. Select to repay with 'Other Bank'.
4. Review your repayment details and click 'Confirm & Get Instructions'.
5. Proceed to your debiting third-party bank account to perform a FAST transfer to your GXS FlexiLoan account number. Be mindful to key in the exact amount of your instruction.
Pro tip
: Set up your GXS FlexiLoan account with your third-party bank account before your due date, as some banks have a cool-down period before allowing transfers.
Here's how to set up your GXS FlexiLoan account:
On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, select 'Manage'
Tap 'Get Account Details', and youâ€™ll see your GXS beneficiary name, account number, bank name, bank code, and branch code
Log in to your third-party bank account
In that bank account, key in your GXS FlexiLoan account details to save your GXS FlexiLoan account as a payee. Youâ€™re good to go!
Pro tip
: Have more than 1 loan? Use the 'Quick Pay Due Option' to pay your upcoming monthly due amount across all loans.
On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, tap on 'Quick Pay Due'
Select to repay with your 'GXS Savings Account' or 'Other Bank'
Review your repayment details and follow the on-screen instructions
Do note that any overdue loan amounts you have will need to be cleared before you can repay other loans.

================================================================================

Title: When is my first monthly GXS FlexiLoan repayment due? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_Repayment/When_is_my_first_monthly_GXS_FlexiLoan_repayment_due%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:31.631999

================================================================================

Your first monthly GXS FlexiLoan repayment due date will fall at least one month from the date that you've borrowedÂ your first loan.
For example, if you borrowÂ your first loan on 15 January and you've selected the 20th of every month as your repayment date, your first monthly repayment date will be on 20 February.

================================================================================

Title: How are interest savings for my Instalment Loans calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/How_are_interest_savings_for_my_Instalment_Loans_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:34.501307

================================================================================

Interest is calculated on a daily, non-compounding basis. You can check your total interest saved upon entering your repayment amount.
If an early repayment is made, it will be deducted from your outstanding GXS FlexiLoan balance on that day, resulting in interest savings for you as interest is calculated on a reduced outstanding balance instead. The interest amount that you saved will be shown in your GXS Bank app during the repayment process.
We recommend taking out a loan only when necessary and with careful consideration. GXS FlexiLoan is designed to provide flexibility and support during unexpected situations. While early repayment is possible with interest savings and at no fees, we advise against taking out loans that are not truly needed. The bank conducts periodic reviews to ensure that our customers are using our products responsibly and with prudence. The bank may impose fees/charges and/or interest for the provision of our services and products and has the right to change the amount of such fees/charges and/or interest.

================================================================================

Title: How is my Instalment Loan interest payable calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/How_is_my_Instalment_Loan_interest_payable_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:37.295339

================================================================================

Interest is calculated on a daily non-compounding basis. This means that the interest is charged on your outstanding GXS FlexiLoan balance each day.
To calculate the interest payable across your loan tenure when you first takeÂ a loan - For example, if you took a loan of S$10,000Â with a tenure of 3 years:
Annual Percentage Rate (APR): 3% p.a.
Effective Interest Rate (EIR): 5.69% p.a.
Tenure: 3 years
Borrowed loan amount: S$10,000
Total interest payable = Loan * APR * tenure
= S$10,000 * 3% / 365 * (365 * 3 years)
= S$900
*The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the total borrowing cost, expressed as a yearly rate, relative to the initial loan amount.
The Effective Interest Rate (EIR) is the rate that reflects the true cost of borrowing and takes into account total charges. It's computed over a reducing balance basis and accrued daily.

================================================================================

Title: How is the late interest for my Instalment Loan calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/How_is_the_late_interest_for_my_Instalment_Loan_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:40.195366

================================================================================

While there are no late fees involved, late interest charges will be applicable for late payments. These charges vary based on how late your payments are.

================================================================================

Title: What are Effective Interest Rate (EIR) and Annual Percentage Rate (APR) for my Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/What_are_Effective_Interest_Rate_(EIR)_and_Annual_Percentage_Rate_(APR)_for_my_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:43.676854

================================================================================

The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the total borrowing cost, expressed as a yearly rate, relative to the initial loan amount.
The Effective Interest Rate (EIR) is the rate that reflects the true cost of borrowing and takes into account total charges. It's computed over a reducing balance basis and accrued daily.
For example, if you took a loan of S$10,000 with a tenure of 3 years:
APR: 3% p.a.
EIR: 5.69% p.a.
Tenure: 3 years
Borrowed loan amount: S$10,000
Total interest payable = Loan * APR * tenure
= S$10,000 * 3% * 3 years
= S$900
Monthly repayment amount = (interest payable + principal) / tenure
= (S$900 + S$10,000) / 36 months
= S$302.78
The interest payable component forms part of your repayment amount based on the interest accrued daily calculated using EIR and your outstanding principal balance.

================================================================================

Title: What are the fees I need to pay for my Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/What_are_the_fees_I_need_to_pay_for_my_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:46.486005

================================================================================

Lucky you! There are zero fees involved for your Instalment Loans, be it early repayment fees, processing fees or late fees. While there are no fees, you will still be charged late interest for late repayments. Simply pay on time to avoid this.

================================================================================

Title: Where can I find my Instalment Loan interest rates? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_FlexiLoan_-_Instalment_Loan_Fees_and_Interest/Where_can_I_find_my_Instalment_Loan_interest_rates%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:49.327414

================================================================================

You may also find your interest rate within the GXS FlexiLoan home screen right beneath your credit limit.
*The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the total borrowing cost, expressed as a yearly rate, relative to the initial loan amount.
The Effective Interest Rate (EIR) is the rate that reflects the true cost of borrowing and takes into account total charges. It's computed over a reducing balance basis and accrued daily.

================================================================================

Title: Can I borrow more than one Balance Transfer from my GXS FlexiLoan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/Can_I_borrow_more_than_one_Balance_Transfer_from_my_GXS_FlexiLoan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:52.225295

================================================================================

Balance Transfer can only be takenÂ once, unless otherwise allocated by the bank.
Do note that in combination with Instalment Loans, you can only borrow up to 10 loans at any one point in time from your available credit.
This means that if you have already taken 10 Instalment Loans, you will not be able to take a Balance Transfer until you have fully repaid at least 1 Instalment Loan.

================================================================================

Title: How do I borrow a Balance Transfer loan from GXS FlexiLoan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/How_do_I_borrow_a_Balance_Transfer_loan_from_GXS_FlexiLoan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:55.164275

================================================================================

Here are the steps to borrow a Balance Transfer loan:
Open your GXS Bank app. On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, tap on 'Borrow'.
Select â€˜Balance Transferâ€™ on the top bar. You may tap on the â€˜changeâ€™ icon to change your loan type.
Key in the amount you need. Note that a fee will be deducted from this amount.
Select the tenure of your loan.
If this is your first loan, you can choose the date which you prefer to pay monthly e.g. 15th of each month.
Name your loan (to indicate its purpose!).
Select where youâ€™d like to transfer your loan to.
Review the transfer details and click 'Confirm'.
You can choose to transfer funds into a third-party bank account via PayNow held in your own name.
However, before taking the Balance Transfer loan, doÂ ensure you have a third-party bank account connected to your PayNow, via mobile number and/or NRIC.

================================================================================

Title: How do I calculate the monthly repayment amount of my Balance Transfer loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/How_do_I_calculate_the_monthly_repayment_amount_of_my_Balance_Transfer_loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:15:58.521273

================================================================================

You can easily simulate the monthly amount payable when you go through the borrowing journey on the GXS Bank app.
A minimum percentage of the loan principal will need to be paid each month - you can refer to your app for the minimum percentage payable. The remaining balance will then be payable by the end of the tenure.
The one-time processing fee forms part of the loan amount payable over the selected tenure.
For example:
Interest (APR): 0%
Selected tenure: 4 months
One time processing fee: 1.35% (EIR 4.13%)
Minimum percentage payable each month except for final month: 1%
Loan Principal = Amount requested by you
= $10,000
Monthly repayment each month except for final month = Loan Principal x Minimum percentage payable
= $10,000 x 1%
= $100
Amount payable in final month = Loan Principal - [Monthly repayment each month x (Tenure - 1)]
= $10,000 - [$100 x (4 - 1)]
= $10,000 - $300
= $9,700
This means that your repayment schedule is as follows:
Month 1: $100
Month 2: $100
Month 3: $100
Month 4: $9,700
*The Annual Percentage Rate (APR) represents the total borrowing cost, expressed as a yearly rate, relative to the initial loan amount.

================================================================================

Title: How much of my credit limit can I utilise for a Balance Transfer loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/How_much_of_my_credit_limit_can_I_utilise_for_a_Balance_Transfer_loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:01.470362

================================================================================

You will be granted a sub-limit from which you can take a Balance Transfer loan. This sub-limit is a percentage of your GXS FlexiLoan credit limit.
Here's how you can locate the sub-limit on the GXS Bank app:
Open your GXS Bank app. On your GXS FlexiLoan home screen, tap on 'Borrow'.
Tap on the â€˜changeâ€™ icon, there you will see the Balance Transfer limit which you can borrowÂ your loan from.

================================================================================

Title: How much will I receive when I take a Balance Transfer? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/How_much_will_I_receive_when_I_take_a_Balance_Transfer%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:04.541845

================================================================================

The one-time processing fee forms part of the loan amount payable over the selected tenure.
It will be deducted from the amount you have chosen to borrow. From there, the remaining amount will be disbursed to your selected PayNow account.
For example:
Loan Principal = Amount requested by you
= S$10,000
Processing fee percentage = 1.35%
Processing fee amount = Processing fee percentage x Loan Principal
= 1.35% x S$10,000
= S$135
Amount you will receive = Loan Principal - Fee amount
= S$10,000 - S$135
= S$9,865

Title: What's the minimum/maximum Balance Transfer amount I can borrow from my GXS FlexiLoan? - GXS Help Centre

Title: What is Balance Transfer? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/What_is_Balance_Transfer%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:11.028481

================================================================================

Balance Transfer is one of the loan types that you can takeÂ from GXS FlexiLoan.
Balance Transfer
might be the loan for you if these are your needs:
Conserve cash by making smaller repayments each month over a shorter period. Minimum monthly repayment could be as low as 1% of your loan principal (or at such other rate as stipulated by the bank)
Select a loan tenure of 4 - 12 months (as assigned by the bank) and repay the remaining outstanding only at the end of the tenure
Enjoy 0% interest with a one-time processing fee (EIR 4.13% p.a.)
Do note that you can takeÂ a Balance Transfer only once, unless otherwise allocated by the bank.
Possible uses: Support your financial goals, emergencies, short-term business cash-flow cycles, managing multiple outstanding balances with a single facility etc.
*Effective Interest Rate (EIR) for Balance Transfer is calculated with an average loan amount of $10,000, with a 4-month repayment period, from 1 Jan 2024 and a minimum monthly due of 1% of loan principal.
Illustration of a Balance Transfer loan, terms below may defer:
Loan principal: S$10,000
Selected tenure: 4 months
Processing Fee: 1.35%
Minimum monthly due: 1%

Title: What is the minimum repayment amount for Balance Transfer? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:17.549056

The minimum repayment amount is the amount that you need to pay each month prior to the final month. The minimum repayment amount needs to be repaid on time to avoid late interest.
You may find your minimum repayment percentage allocated to you once you have successfully signed up for GXS FlexiLoan. It will also be reflected in your borrowing journey before you confirm the loan to borrow.

Title: Why canâ€™t I take a Balance Transfer loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Borrow_a_Balance_Transfer/Why_can%E2%80%99t_I_take_a_Balance_Transfer_loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:20.795780

================================================================================

We are sorry to hear that. Below could be some reasons why you canâ€™t borrow a loan:
1 Balance Transfer: Only 1 Balance Transfer loan can be borrowedÂ unless otherwise allocated by the bank.
10 active loans: In combination with Instalment Loans, you can only borrow up to 10 loans at any one point in time from your available credit limit.
Insufficient credit limit: You do not have sufficient credit limit to borrow a loan.
Borrowing of a loan is in progress: You may have a loanÂ that is pending
Balance-To-Income (BTI): Your total interest-bearing outstanding balance on all unsecured credit facilities across all banks in Singapore exceeds the industry-wide borrowing limit for 3 consecutive months. To find out more about BTI, refer
here
.
60 days past due: Any one of your loans was unpaid for 60 days past the due date.
The bank reserves the right to suspend the borrowing of loans for any other reasons.

Title: How is my Balance Transfer processing fee calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/GXS_Flexiloan_-_Balance_Transfer_Fees_and_Interest/How_is_my_Balance_Transfer_processing_fee_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:23.711570

================================================================================

Balance Transfer one-time processing fee is calculated as a percentage of your loan principal. The one-time processing fee forms part of the loan amount payable over the selected tenure.
It will be deducted from the amount you have chosen to borrow. From there, the remaining amount will be disbursed to your selected PayNow account.
For example:
Loan Principal = Amount requested by you
= S$10,000
Processing fee percentage = 1.35%
Processing fee amount = Processing fee percentage x Loan Principal
= 1.35% x S$10,000
= S$135

Title: How do I know if my Balance Transfer Loan is eligible for splitting? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/How_do_I_know_if_my_Balance_Transfer_Loan_is_eligible_for_splitting%3F

Some reasons why you may not be eligible may include:
You currently have loans which are overdue
The outstanding balance on your Balance Transfer Loan is less than S$200
Your account is currently suspended from further borrowing

Title: How is the new Instalment Loan amount calculated after splitting my Balance Transfer Loan into an Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/How_is_the_new_Instalment_Loan_amount_calculated_after_splitting_my_Balance_Transfer_Loan_into_an_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:48.144463

================================================================================

The new Instalment Loan principal amount will be the remaining outstanding balance of your Balance Transfer Loan. Depending on the loan tenure you selected for your conversion, we will compute a new monthly instalment amount for you. Your prevailing GXS FlexiLoan interest rate will apply to the converted Instalment Loan.
Illustration
On 1 January 2024, a GXS FlexiLoan - Balance Transfer Loan of $10,000 was takenÂ for a 6 month tenure at a minimum monthly due rate of 1%. Table 1 shows how your loan schedule may look like.
A month before your final repayment due date on 1 July 2024, you realise you may need more time to repay your outstanding balance of $9,500 - this outstanding amount of S$9,500 can then be converted into an Instalment Loan to split the repayment into more manageable monthly repayments. You have the choice of tenure for the Instalment Loan.
Once converted, your prevailing GXS FlexiLoan interest rate will apply to the Instalment Loan. Assuming you selected a 3 month tenure and your GXS FlexiLoan interest rate is APR 2.99% p.a. (EIR 4.50% p.a.). Table 2 shows how your new loan schedule may look like.
Split date: 1 June 2024
Monthly repayment date: 1st day of month
Split Instalment Loan principal: S$9,500
Loan tenure: 3 months
Interest amount payable: 2.99% p.a. for 3 months = S$71.60
Total loan payable: S$9,500 + S$71.60 = S$9,571.60
Equal Monthly Instalment payable: S$9,571.60 / 3 = S$3,190.53

================================================================================

Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:51.177521

Title: Is there a minimum or maximum tenure for the split of Balance Transfer Loan into Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre

Title: What are the benefits of splitting my Balance Transfer Loan into an Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/What_are_the_benefits_of_splitting_my_Balance_Transfer_Loan_into_an_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:56.853862

================================================================================

By converting your final Balance Transfer Loan repayment amount, your repayment period will be further extended for a period of time. This can also help you avoid late interest charges and better manage your financial obligations.
Psst â€¦ note that the first instalment payable on your converted Instalment Loan is as soon as one month from the date which you choose to split your Balance Transfer Loan.
For example, you requested a split of your Balance Transfer Loan on 1 June 2024. Your first instalment payable for the converted Instalment Loan may start as early as 1 July 2024.

================================================================================

Title: What does it mean to split your Balance Transfer Loan into an Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/What_does_it_mean_to_split_your_Balance_Transfer_Loan_into_an_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:16:59.839819

================================================================================

A 'split' of your Balance Transfer Loan allows you to convert your outstanding Balance Transfer Loan into an Instalment Loan; essentially splitting your remaining Balance Transfer Loan outstanding into bite-sized equal monthly repayments.
This is especially useful when you are nearing the final repayment of your Balance Transfer Loan, which tends to be a relatively larger amount. By converting your final Balance Transfer Loan repayment amount, your repayment period will be further extended for a period of time.
But hurry! This must be done before the final repayment date of your Balance Transfer Loan. You can choose to activate this â€˜splitâ€™ feature anytime before your Balance Transfer Loan expires as long as none of your loans are overdue and your Balance Transfer Loan outstanding balance is at least S$200.
Illustration
On 1 January 2024, a GXS FlexiLoan - Balance Transfer Loan of $10,000 was takenÂ for a 6 month tenure at a minimum monthly due rate of 1%. Table 1 shows how your loan schedule may look like.
A month before your final repayment due date on 1 July 2024, you realise you may need more time to repay your outstanding balance of $9,500 - this outstanding amount of S$9,500 can then be converted into an Instalment Loan to split the repayment into more manageable monthly repayments. You have the choice of tenure for the Instalment Loan.
Once converted, your prevailing GXS FlexiLoan interest rate will apply to the Instalment Loan. Assuming you selected a 3 month tenure and your GXS FlexiLoan interest rate is APR 2.99% p.a. (EIR 4.50% p.a.). Table 2 shows how your new loan schedule may look like.
Split date: 1 June 2024
Monthly repayment date: 1st day of month
Split Instalment Loan principal: $9,500
Loan tenure: 3 months
Interest amount payable: 2.99% p.a. for 3 months = S$71.60
Total loan payable: S$9,500 + S$71.60 = S$9,571.60
Equal Monthly Instalment payable: S$9,571.60 / 3 = S$3,190.53

================================================================================

Title: What happens if I miss a repayment on my new Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/What_happens_if_I_miss_a_repayment_on_my_new_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:17:02.660846

================================================================================

If you miss a repayment on your new Instalment Loan, late interest charges will be applicable. These charges vary based on how late your repayments are.
Pro-tip: It is crucial to make timely repayments to avoid any negative impact on your credit score.
Late interest charges has beenÂ increased from 18% p.a. to 28% p.a., chargeable from 3 days past the repayment date. The 2 day grace period will continue to remain in effect. This has taken effect on 1 November 2024.

================================================================================

Title: What happens to my Balance Transfer Loan once it is split? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/What_happens_to_my_Balance_Transfer_Loan_once_it_is_split%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:17:05.907833

================================================================================

Once your Balance Transfer Loan is split, it will be closed and a new Instalment Loan will be opened with the remaining outstanding Balance Transfer Loan amount as the principal amount. The terms of the new loan, including the interest rate and repayment schedule, will be provided to you before the conversion is finalised.
Note that the first instalment payable on your converted Instalment Loan is as soon as one month from the date which you choose to split your Balance Transfer Loan.
For example, you requested a split of your Balance Transfer Loan on 1 June 2024. Your first instalment payable for the converted Instalment Loan will start in July 2024.

================================================================================

Title: What makes up the principal loan amount for my converted Instalment Loan? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan/Split_a_Balance_Transfer/What_makes_up_the_principal_loan_amount_for_my_converted_Instalment_Loan%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T01:17:08.726110

================================================================================

The principal amount of your new Instalment Loan is based on the remaining outstanding balance of your Balance Transfer Loan. Only the full outstanding Balance Transfer Loan amount can be split into an Instalment Loan, you will not be able to select a partial amount. If you would like to convert a smaller amount, we suggest repaying a portion of your Balance Transfer first.
Interest payable will be calculated using your prevailing GXS FlexiLoan interest rate and the repayment period based on the tenure you select for your new Instalment Loan.

================================================================================

Open a GXS Biz Account
No image available

Title: My physical GXS Debit Card was lost / stolen. What should I do? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Manage_Card_Disputes_and_Issues/My_physical_GXS_Debit_Card_was_lost_%2F%2F_stolen._What_should_I_do%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:07.684022
Word Count: 228
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

If you suspect that your GXS Debit Card is lost or compromised, please freeze your card to prevent any transactions:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, tap on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Tap on 'Manage Card'.
Tap on 'Freeze Card'.
Confirm the Freeze request.
Freezing your card also means that both your virtual and physical GXS Debit Cards will be frozen.
If you're certain that you have lost your GXS Debit Card, please cancel your card:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, click on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Tap on 'Manage Card'.
Select 'Cancel card'.
Select 'Cancel card' again to confirm.
Once your card is successfully cancelled, you will be prompted to create a new GXS Debit Card.
Cancelling your card using the above steps means that both your virtual and physical GXS Debit Cards will be cancelled. Your card can no longer be used.
Replacing your GXS Debit Card is free. When you create a new GXS Debit Card, your card details such as your card number and CVC will change as well. This will affect any recurringÂ arrangements you might have with your card, so please change your details accordingly with your billing merchants.
If you have any unauthorised card transactions, raise a dispute
here
.

================================================================================

Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:10.606397

================================================================================

Go to 'Main Account'.
Select 'More Options' (3 dots next to 'Account Balance').
Tap 'View my Statement'.

Title: I did not receive my refund from my GXS Debit Card transaction. What should I do? - GXS Help Centre

Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

You may not have received the refunds due to the following reasons:
Refunds have to be processed by the merchants before they're refunded to the Main Account of your GXS Savings Account. If you're due for a refund and it isn't showing in your account, please reach out to the merchant for more assistance.

Title: I don't recognise a transaction on my GXS Debit Card. What should I do? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Manage_Card_Disputes_and_Issues/I_don't_recognise_a_transaction_on_my_GXS_Debit_Card._What_should_I_do%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:16.561623
Word Count: 218
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

You can raise a dispute for the transaction either from the Transaction Details view or through the Help Centre.
To raise a dispute from the Transaction Details view, you need to:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, tap on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Scroll through the transactions to find the suspicious transaction.
Select the transaction to open up the Transaction Details view.
Tap on 'Get Help'.
Select 'Contact us via email'.
Under â€˜Did you authorise this transactionâ€™, select 'Yes' or 'No'.
Next, select the appropriate reason under 'Reasons for dispute'.
Lastly, provide any details and documents to support the investigation about this dispute.
To raise a dispute through the Help Centre, you need to:
On the GXS Bank app Help Centre, tap on 'Get more help'.
Tap on 'Contact us via email' and select 'Card transaction dispute' under â€˜What kind of issue is it?â€™.
Enter the Transaction ID you wish to dispute. You can copy this from the Transaction Details view.
Under â€˜Did you authorise this transactionâ€™, select 'Yes' or 'No'.
Next, select the appropriate reason under 'Reasons for dispute'.
Lastly, provide any supporting details and documents to support the investigation about this dispute.
Do note that for unauthorised transactions, the bank will perform a card block to protect your account.

================================================================================

Title: Why am I being charged $0.10 for my BUS/MRT rides by GXS Bank? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Fees_and_Charges_of_GXS_Debit_Card/Why_am_I_being_charged_%240.10_for_my_BUS%2F%2FMRT_rides_by_GXS_Bank%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:35.098109
Word Count: 110
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

We understand that every cent matters! When you tap your GXS Debit Card at the gantry, a $0.10 pre-authorisation charge is made to ensure your card is active and ready. Not to worry, this isn't your actual fare and it'll be promptly returned once the final transaction details from SimplyGo come in.
If for any reason the $0.10 charge fails, fret not! You can approach the staff at the MRT station for further assistance. Alternatively, you can also top up your GXS Saving Account's Main Account and give it another go. Once the $0.10 pre-authorisation is done, you should be able to exit by tapping your card at the gantry.

================================================================================

Title: How do I activate my physical GXS Debit Card? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Order_and_Delivery_of_GXS_Debit_Card/How_do_I_activate_my_physical_GXS_Debit_Card%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:38.138868
Word Count: 61
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Here's how you can activate your brand new GXS Debit Card!
From the home screen, tap on 'Debit Card'Â icon.
Tap 'Activate Now'Â on the blue banner.
Confirm and tap the 'Activate Card'Â button.
Verify yourself via biometric or passcode.
Key in the 5-digit verification code found on your Debit Card mailer.
Tap 'Activate' again and you are ready to go!

================================================================================

Title: How do I replace my GXS Debit Card? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Order_and_Delivery_of_GXS_Debit_Card/How_do_I_replace_my_GXS_Debit_Card%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:41.579381
Word Count: 104
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Replacing your GXS Debit Card is free. To request for a new physical card, you'll have to cancel your current virtual and physical cards. Here's how:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, click on the Debit Card debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Tap on 'Manage Card'.
Select 'Cancel card'.
Select 'Cancel card' again to confirm.
Once your card is successfully cancelled, tap 'Yes' to create a new GXS Debit Card card.
There are 3 choices of GXS Debit Card designs for you to choose from. Have a look
here
at the different colours that we're offering.

================================================================================

Title: How do I cancel my GXS Debit Card? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Usage_of_GXS_Debit_Card/How_do_I_cancel_my_GXS_Debit_Card%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:44.373057
Word Count: 135
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

We highly recommend keeping your GXS Debit Card so that you can transact by accessing the funds in your GXS Savings Account. Cancelling your virtual GXS Debit Card will also cancel your physical card, if you have one.
If you wish to proceed:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, click on the Debit Card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Tap on 'Manage Card'.
Select 'Cancel card'.
Select 'Cancel card' again to confirm.
Do note that cancelling your card cannot be undone. You will have to create a new card via the GXS App to use the card features. You will also have to place a new order for the physical card.
If you do cancel your card, please cut the physical card and dispose of it for security reasons.

================================================================================

Title: How do I set a spending limit on my GXS Debit Card? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Usage_of_GXS_Debit_Card/How_do_I_set_a_spending_limit_on_my_GXS_Debit_Card%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:50.282284
Word Count: 56
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

On the home screen of your GXS Bank app, click on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Select 'Manage Card'.
Tap 'Edit daily transaction limit'.
Adjust your limit and click on 'Confirm'.
From here on, card transactions that will lead to you exceeding your daily limit won't be approved.

Title: How do we calculate and charge the actual fare to your GXS Debit Card for BUS/MRT rides? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Fees_and_Charges_of_GXS_Debit_Card/How_do_we_calculate_and_charge_the_actual_fare_to_your_GXS_Debit_Card_for_BUS%2F%2FMRT_rides%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:53.597644
Word Count: 113
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

We're here to make your Bus / MRT rides smooth and worry-free! Your fare is calculated based on your journey, and it's deducted only when you exit a gantry. Under SimplyGo, your rides are bundled together and a final transaction is made either when you've clocked $15 in fares or after five days of rides, whichever comes first.
If your GXS Savings Account's Main Account does not have enough to cover a ride or a transaction, it's okay! Your account will go into negative balance, meaning it goes below zero. We've got no penalties for that. Please top up your account at the soonest to ensure there is sufficient funds for future purchases.

================================================================================

Title: I see a settlement date in my GXS Debit Card transaction details. What does this mean? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Usage_of_GXS_Debit_Card/I_see_a_settlement_date_in_my_GXS_Debit_Card_transaction_details._What_does_this_mean%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:03:56.398373
Word Count: 67
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Settlement date is the date on which the funds you spent with your GXS Debit Card are transferred to the merchant.
As settlement is initiated by the merchant, the settlement date may happen any time from a few days to weeks after your transaction date.
From the time of your transaction until the settlement date, the funds were placed on hold and not available for your use.

================================================================================

Your maximum balance amount of your GXS Savings Account has been reached, at the time of the Cash Reward crediting
The crediting of the Cash Reward willÂ cause the balance amount of your GXS Savings Account to be reached.
You can also refer to the
Rewards Terms
for the full list of excluded transactions.

Title: How do I enable my physical GXS Debit Card for overseas use? - GXS Help Centre

Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

As a security measure, your physical GXS Debit Card is disabled for overseas use by default. To change this:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, tap on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Tap on 'Settings'.
Tap on 'Manage Card'.
Toggle on 'Overseas transactions'.
You can follow the above steps to enable or disable your GXS Debit Card for overseas use at any time.

Rewards Terms and Conditions

Title: What should I do if a merchant has charged me multiple times on my GXS Debit Card for a wrong amount, goods not received, or services not rendered? And what if I've yet to receive a refund? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Debit_Card/Manage_Card_Disputes_and_Issues/What_should_I_do_if_a_merchant_has_charged_me_multiple_times_on_my_GXS_Debit_Card_for_a_wrong_amount%2C_goods_not_received%2C_or_services_not_rendered%3F_And_what_if_I've_yet_to_receive_a_refund%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:04:36.376136
Word Count: 273
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Oops, sorry to hear if you're having trouble with a merchant. Do reach out to the respective merchant and seek their help for investigation.
If you are unable to resolve the matter with the merchant, you can raise a dispute from the Transaction Details view on the GXS Bank app:
On the GXS Bank app home screen, tap on the debit card icon by your GXS Savings Account balance.
Scroll through the transactions to find the suspicious transaction.
Select the transaction to open up the Transaction Details view.
Tap on 'Get Help'.
Select 'Contact us via email'.
Under 'Did you authorise this transaction', select 'Yes' or 'No'.
Next, select the appropriate reason under 'Reasons for dispute'.
Lastly, provide any details and documents to support the investigation about this dispute.
Alternatively, you can also raise a dispute through the Help Centre in the app:
On the GXS Bank app Help Centre, tap on 'Get more help'.
Tap on 'Contact us via email' and select 'Card transaction dispute' under 'What kind of issue is it?'.
Enter the Transaction ID you wish to dispute. You can copy this from the Transaction Details view.
Under 'Did you authorise this transaction', select 'Yes' or 'No'.
Next, select the appropriate reason under 'Reasons for dispute'.
Lastly, provide any supporting details and documents to support the investigation about this dispute.
The time required to resolve the dispute may vary depending on its complexity. It may take about 12 weeks to investigate the dispute, assuming the necessary documents are provided promptly.
Do note that we will only accept cases where transactions are made within 60 days from the date of purchase.

Title: I see a settlement date in my GXS FlexiCard transaction details. What does this mean? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/Usage_of_GXS_FlexiCard/I_see_a_settlement_date_in_my_GXS_FlexiCard_transaction_details._What_does_this_mean%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:04:54.483263
Word Count: 88
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

The settlement date is the date on which the amount that you've spent on your GXS FlexiCard is transferred to the merchant.
Since the settlement is initiated by the merchant, the settlement date can occur anytime from a few days to several weeks after your transaction date.
From the time of your transaction until the settlement date, there will be a hold on your card's credit limit for the transaction amount. This hold will reduce your available credit limit and will remain in place until the settlement date.

Title: How is a bus/MRT fare calculated and charged to my GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Fees_and_Charges/How_is_a_bus%2F%2FMRT_fare_calculated_and_charged_to_my_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:05:12.477544
Word Count: 98
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Your bus/MRT fare is calculated based on your journey, and it's deducted only when you exit a gantry. Under SimplyGo, your rides are bundled together and a final transaction is made either when you've clocked S$15 in fares or after five days of rides, whichever comes first.
If your GXS FlexiCard does not have sufficient credit limit to cover a ride or transaction, your account may go into overlimit state. Please make payment to your card account immediately.

here
.

here

Title: Why am I being charged S$0.10 for my bus/MRT rides on my GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Fees_and_Charges/Why_am_I_being_charged_S%240.10_for_my_bus%2F%2FMRT_rides_on_my_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:05:15.726355
Word Count: 100
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

When you tap your GXS FlexiCard on the fare gantry, a S$0.10 pre-authorisation charge is made to ensure your card is active and ready. Don't worry, this isn't your actual fare. It will be promptly returned once the final transaction details from SimplyGo are processed.
If the S$0.10 charge is unsuccessful for any reason, don't fret! You can approach the staff at the MRT station for assistance. Alternatively, you can make a payment to your GXS FlexiCard and try again. Once the S$0.10 pre-authorisation is successful, you should be able to exit by tapping your card on the fare gantry.

================================================================================

Title: What does overlimit mean for my GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/Usage_of_GXS_FlexiCard/1What_does_overlimit_mean_for_my_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:05:18.433555
Word Count: 138
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Your GXS FlexiCard enters an overlimit state if the total outstanding balance, including unbilled amounts, exceeds your assigned credit limit.
The overlimit amount will be detailed in your statement of account and represents the balance that exceeds your credit limit. This amount must be repaid immediately.
Please note that the minimum payment amount set out in your statement will take into consideration the overlimit amount.
Scenario
Statement generation date: 22 October 2024
Current statement outstanding balance: S$495
Due date: 5 November 2024
On 28 October 2024, your FlexiCard account incurred a charge of $37.50 that went through and this exceeded the credit limit by S$32.50. This overlimit amount of S$32.50 will be added to your outstanding balance, but the overspent amount has to be paid immediately.
To learn more about GXS FlexiCard minimum payment amount, click
here
.

================================================================================

Title: How much will I get back in the event of an order cancellation? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Invest/7_Day_Cancellation_Period/How_much_will_I_get_back_in_the_event_of_an_order_cancellation%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:05:32.430495
Word Count: 138
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Any order to redeem placed successfully on the GXS Bank app before 3:30pm will be processed on the same day (provided such day is a relevant dealing day). If the order to redeem is placed after 3:30pm, the transaction shall be processed the next dealing day instead.
The redemption proceeds that will be paid to you will be the number of units redeemed multiplied by the NAV of the relevant dealing day.
There will be no penalty or fees imposed on customers for the cancellation of the Purchase Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, GXS Bank does not charge any sales charge or front-end fee for the Purchase Agreement as well.
Customers are to note that the published prices are indicative in nature and can change during the period between the submission and processing of the redemption request.

================================================================================

Title: I have a GXS FlexiLoan account. Why canâ€™t I apply for GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiCard/I_have_a_GXS_FlexiLoan_account._Why_can%E2%80%99t_I_apply_for_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:05:33.586652
Word Count: 51
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

We're sorry we can't offer you a GXS FlexiCard right now. We can only provide either a GXS FlexiLoan or a GXS FlexiCard to a customer. This means that if you already have a GXS FlexiLoan account, or have closed your GXS FlexiLoan account, you aren't eligible for a GXS FlexiCard.

Title: Can I pay more than my GXS FlexiCard outstanding balance? - GXS Help Centre

Word Count: 80
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Yes, you may choose to pay more than the outstanding balance. You can also make payment earlier than the stated due date.
Should you decide to overpay your GXS FlexiCard account, do note that only a maximum excess balance of S$500 is allowed. This excess balance of S$500 is on top of the S$500 credit limit provided to you.
Any excess balance will be used to offset your following monthâ€™s statement and it is also non-transferable to other GXS accounts.

Title: Am I eligible to apply for a GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiCard/Am_I_eligible_to_apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:06:01.776679
Word Count: 127
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

You will be eligible to apply for a GXS FlexiCard when you meet all of the following criteria:
Age: between 21 - 55 years
Nationality: Singapore Citizen/ Singapore Permanent Resident
Do not have a GXS FlexiLoan account or Grab DAX PCA (Partner Cash Advance) account or GXS Biz Account and/or GXS FlexiLoan Biz
While there is no income requirement to apply for a GXS FlexiCard, do note that all GXS FlexiCard applications go through an evaluation process which is aligned with our internal requirements. This process includes an assessment of the applicantâ€™s credit profile and eligibility. For Grab users, including Grab drivers and delivery partners, your transactions and earnings may be relevant for credit assessments and could be shared between Grab and GXS Bank for these purposes.

Once your card is successfully canceled, tap 'Yes' to create a new GXS FlexiCard.

Title: How do I pay my GXS FlexiCard bills? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Payment/6How_do_I_pay_my_GXS_FlexiCard_bills%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:06:14.158954
Word Count: 134
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

You can pay your GXS FlexiCard bill via the following method(s):
Using your GXS Savings Account to pay via the GXS Bank app:
On the GXS FlexiCard homescreen, click on 'Pay Due'
Select the amount you'd like to repay
Choose 'GXS Savings Account' as your payment method
Review your payment details and click 'Confirm & Pay'
Using an external bank account to pay with FAST transfer:
Log in to the GXS Bank app to check your GXS FlexiCard bill outstanding amount and retrieve your card/account number
Proceed to your external bank app/online banking platform to perform a FAST transfer to your GXS FlexiCardÂ number
Ensure you choose FAST payment to a bank account, not credit card account.
Enter your 16-digit GXS FlexiCard number in the bank account field
Note: FAST transfers are almost instantaneous!

Title: My physical GXS FlexiCard was lost/stolen. What should I do? - GXS Help Centre

Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:06:29.487018

Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

On the GXS Bank app FlexiCard homescreen, tap on 'Freeze' or 'Unfreeze'.
Confirm the Freeze or Unfreeze request.
If you're certain that you have lost your GXS FlexiCard, please cancel your card immediately.
To cancel your GXS FlexiCard:
On the GXS FlexiCard homescreen, tap on 'Manage'.
Select 'Cancel card'.
Select 'Cancel' again to confirm.

You can follow these steps anytime to enable or disable your GXS FlexiCard for overseas use.

Title: How is minimum payment calculated for GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Payment/5How_is_minimum_payment_calculated_for_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:06:38.635940
Word Count: 111
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Calculation of minimum payment for your GXS FlexiCard first takes into consideration:
Your billed outstanding amount due:
If total billed outstanding amount is less than S$15 - minimum payment will be the same amount.
If more than or equal to S$15 - minimum payment amount will be S$15.
Once the above is calculated, the below charges (if any) will be added to form the total minimum payment:
2.Â  Overdue principal (if any).
3.Â  Fees accrued eg. flexi fee, late fee, annual fee (if any).
4.Â  Overlimit amount (if any) will be added to your current statement's minimum payment amount.
Here are two illustrative examples on how minimum payment amount is derived:

Title: What are the fees I need to be aware of for GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Fees_and_Charges/What_are_the_fees_I_need_to_be_aware_of_for_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:06:48.320089
Word Count: 165
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Here are the three fees associated with GXS FlexiCard:
Annual fee
Flexi fee
Late fee
Annual fee of S$54.50 (inclusive of GST) is waived for the first year.
From the second year onwards, the annual fee will be incurred on each anniversary of your GXS FlexiCard. For example, if you successfully applied for a GXS FlexiCard on 1 January 2025, the first annual fee of S$54.50 will be charged on 1 January 2026. And for all subsequent annual fees, you will be charged on 1 January of the following years.
Eligibility for a waiver in subsequent years is determined annually and is subject to bank review.
Flexi fee of S$5 will be incurred for each billing cycle where you only make a minimum payment for your FlexiCard on/before payment date, but did not make full payment.
Late fee of S$50 will be incurred for each billing cycle where we do not receive at least minimum payment on your GXS FlexiCard by the payment due date.

================================================================================

Please note that a flexi fee or a late fee will be incurred if you choose to make a partial payment instead of in full.

Title: What is the 28-day annualized yield and how is it calculated? In addition, how does the 28-day annualized yield differ from the fundâ€™s historical return? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Invest/GXS_Invest_Returns/What_is_the_7-day_annualized_yield_and_how_is_it_calculated%3F_In_addition%2C_how_does_the_7-day_annualized_yield_differ_from_the_fund%E2%80%99s_historical_return%3F_Will_the_historical_returns_be_the_same_or_similar_as_the_7-day_annualized_yield%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:07:04.537436
Word Count: 234
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

The published yield is calculated by annualizing the last 28Â dealing days average Net Asset Value (NAV). The formula is as follows:
28-day annualized yield =
(NAV on T+28Â - NAV on T / NAV on T) / Number of Calendar Days * 365 * 100%
This yield can help you gauge the fundâ€™s yield based on the fundâ€™s average NAV over the last 28Â dealing days. However, past performance of an investment does not necessarily reflect its future performance, so the yield does not represent the fundâ€™s future or actual returns and should be used for reference purposes only. The value of investments and investment returns (including dividends, distributions, income or other returns) may rise or fall.
The 28-day annualised yield is a gauge of the fundâ€™s yield based on the fundâ€™s average NAV over the last 28Â dealing days, and does not represent the actual of future performance of the fund. It is calculated and refreshed every day and will fluctuate depending on the underlying instruments within the fund.
The fundâ€™s historical return is based on actual past NAVs and shows how the fund has performed across a period of time.
You may refer to the fund factsheet for the latest updated performance via the following steps:
1. Log in to the GXS Bank app.
2. Tap on 'GXS Invest'.
3. Tap on 'More'.
4. Scroll down and tap 'View Fact Sheet'.

================================================================================

Title: Why should I join Odyssey? - GXS Help Centre

Word Count: 43

================================================================================

Title: How do I read the statuses of my orders? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Invest/GXS_Invest_Orders/How_do_I_read_the_statuses_of_my_orders%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:07:15.978856
Word Count: 241
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

For Buy orders
Order submitted: Your order has been successfully submitted.
Order confirmed: Your order has been confirmed.
Order completed: Your order has been successfully processed and you can view your allocated units in your account.
Unsuccessful: Your Buy order has failed or was cancelled. This could be due to a system error or a trade reversal.
Refund initiated: If your Buy order was unsuccessful, a refund will be initiated as the money for the Buy order has already been debited from your GXS Savings Account.
Refund completed: The refund of the money to your GXS Savings Account resulting from an unsuccessful Buy order has been completed.
For Sell orders
Order submitted: Your order has been successfully submitted.
Order confirmed: Your order has been confirmed and the units will be removed from your account.
Order completed: Your order has been successfully processed and the redemption amount credited into the Main Account of your GXS Savings Account.
Unsuccessful: Your Sell order was unsuccessful. This could be due to a system error or a trade reversal. You may want to make another Sell order.
Crediting failed: Your Sell order has been successfully completed but we are unable to credit the redemption amount as you have hit the maximum balance amount on your GXS Savings Account which consists of funds in your Main Account and Saving Pocket(s). You will need to reduce the balance before we can credit the amount into your Main Account.

================================================================================

Title: How are interest savings for my GXS FlexiLoan Biz calculated? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz/GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz_-_Interest_and_Fees/How_are_interest_savings_for_my_GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz_calculated%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:07:27.359457
Word Count: 74
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Interest is calculated on a daily, non-compounding basis. You can check your total interest saved upon entering your repayment amount.
If an early repayment is made, it will be deducted from your outstanding GXS FlexiLoan Biz balance on that day, resulting in interest savings for you as interest is calculated on a reduced outstanding balance instead. The interest amount that you saved will be shown in your GXS Bank app during the repayment process.

Title: I earn interest daily on my Saving Pockets, are they factored in the guess amount? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Promotions/Pocket_is_Right_campaign/I_earn_interest_daily_on_my_Saving_Pockets%2C_are_they_factored_in_the_guess_amount%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:07:35.971982
Word Count: 78
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

No, interest credited will not be included in your guess amount. Only the nett amount - the total amount you deposited minus the total amount you withdrew during the guess period will be considered your final guess amount.
For e.g. you deposit S$5,000.00 on 5 April, withdraw S$1,000.00 on 20 April and earn interest of S$8.00 for the month.
At the end of the day of 30 April, your guess amount will be S$5,000.00 minus S$1,000.00 = S$4,000.00.

================================================================================

Title: What Grab rewards can I look forward to as both a GXS Business Banking customer and a Grab Merchant? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/?title=GXS_Biz_Account/Grab_%26_Singtel_Experiences/What_Grab_rewards_can_I_look_forward_to_as_both_a_GXS_Business_Banking_customer_and_a_Grab_Merchant%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:07:39.003769
Word Count: 129
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

We have multiple rewards for GXS Business Banking customers who are new and existing Grab Merchants. Whether you're with GrabPay, GrabFood or GrabMart, there are enticing rewards limited to the first 500 sign-ups.
However, the rewards are exclusive for Grab Merchants, subject to GXS Biz Account opening and linking the account as your Grab Merchant settlement account.
For Existing Deliveries (GrabFood & GrabMart) merchants: Waived 12 km Islandwide Delivery subscription fee for 3 months (U.P from $500/mth for Grab Food , from $280/mth for Grab Mart).
OR
For New to Grab Deliveries (GrabFood & GrabMart) merchants: Activation fee rebate (U.P up to $300).
OR
For New and Existing GrabPay-only merchants: MDR rebate - GrabPay in store (P2M) and online (ONA): 0.5% MDR rebate for 1 month (capped at $300).

Title: What is the period required for me to maintain the loan in the GXS Business Banking CNY2025 Cashback Campaign? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz/Chinese_New_Year_2025_Campaign/What_is_the_period_required_for_me_to_maintain_the_loan_in_the_GXS_Business_Banking_CNY2025_Cashback_Campaign%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:08:15.358341
Word Count: 111
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

In order to be eligible for the S$188 or S$388 or S$588 cashback reward, you must borrow the required minimum loan amount from your GXS FlexiLoan Biz by 28 February 2025 and maintain more than 50% of your loan amount three months from the date you first took the loan.
Do note that the cashback reward is limited to the first 500 eligible customers. The first 500 customers are selected on a first-come, first-served basis among those who meet the criteria by either depositing fresh funds into their GXS Biz Account or borrowing a loan from their GXS FlexiLoan Biz account.
For the full promotion Terms and Conditions, do refer
here.

Title: Is there a daily transaction limit for performing Dash transactions using funds from my GXS Savings Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Grab_and_Singtel_Experiences/GXS_on_Singtel_Dash/Is_there_a_daily_transaction_limit_for_performing_Dash_transactions_using_funds_from_my_GXS_Savings_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:08:20.962997
Word Count: 50
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Yes, there is a daily transaction limit for all transactions made on Dash where GXS Savings Account is the payment method (including top ups of your Dash Wallet). By default, your daily transaction limit is automatically set to $1,000. You can change this limit to up to $15,000 per day.

================================================================================

Title: What's the difference between the daily transfer limit on the GXS app, and the daily transaction limit for my linked GXS Savings Account on the Dash app? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Grab_and_Singtel_Experiences/GXS_on_Singtel_Dash/What's_the_difference_between_the_daily_transfer_limit_on_the_GXS_app%2C_and_the_daily_transaction_limit_for_my_linked_GXS_Savings_Account_on_the_Dash_app%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:08:44.976961
Word Count: 81
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Daily transfer limit on GXS Bank app:
This refers to daily amount you can transfer from your GXS Savings Account to other bank accounts, through the various modes of transfer (e.g. PayNow, local bank transfers).
Daily transaction limit for linked GXS Savings Account on Dash app:
This refers to the total daily transactions you can make from your GXS Savings Account on Dash app, including top-ups to your Dash wallet.
Please note that the transfer and transaction limits are not related.

================================================================================

Title: How many users can operate the GXS Biz Account and GXS FlexiLoan Biz? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz/Apply_for_a_GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz/How_many_users_can_operate_the_GXS_Biz_Account_and_GXS_FlexiLoan_Biz%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:08:48.096436
Word Count: 61
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Only one authorised person (who is both the director and a shareholder of the company) can operate and manage the GXS Biz Account and GXS FlexiLoan Biz.
To protect your GXS Bank account, do not share your device where the GXS Bank app is logged in, avoid logging in on a different phone, and never share your GXS Bank app credentials.

From this 'Recent' tab, you can then add a recent recipientÂ as a 'Favourite'. To do this, just select a recipientÂ from the list, tap on the star icon, provide a preferred name for the recipientÂ and save the recipientÂ as Favourite. This FavouriteÂ recipientÂ will now be shown in the 'Favourite' tab.
Congrats! You can now easily initiate a fund transfer to either a 'Recent' or a 'Favourite' recipientÂ with a single tap.

Title: What do I need to open a GXS Biz Account? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Biz_Account/Open_a_GXS_Biz_Account/What_do_I_need_to_open_a_GXS_Biz_Account%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:24.215459
Word Count: 115
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Weâ€™re excited to have you onboard! To open a GXS Biz Account, you'll need to:
Be at least 18 years old.
Have a residential address in Singapore.
Be a Singapore citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident.
Have a Singpass Myinfo account.
Have an active ACRA registration account.
Not currently hold, and never have held, a GXS Savings Account, GXS FlexiLoan Account, or GXS FlexiCard.
Not currently hold, and never have held, a GXS Biz Account or a GXS FlexiLoan Biz.
Make sure that your business details and residential address are updated on ACRA and Singpass respectively, before signing up for an account.
If you require assistance on your Singpass access, you may contact
Singpass Helpdesk
directly.

Title: What is a scheduled transfer? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Biz_Account/GXS_Biz_Account_Payments/What_is_a_scheduled_transfer%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:25.002154
Word Count: 55
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

A scheduled transfer is a feature in the GXS Bank app that allows users to set up automatic money transfers at specific times. These transfers can be set for a one-time event or recurring intervals, like daily, weekly, biweekly, or monthly.
At the moment, scheduled outgoing transfers can only be made using FAST and PayNow.

Title: How do I place a Buy or Sell order for GXS Invest? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Invest/GXS_Invest_Orders/How_do_I_place_a_Buy_or_Sell_order_for_GXS_Invest%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:27.241671
Word Count: 112
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

You can place a Buy or Sell order for Fullerton SGD Cash Fund by following these steps:
1. Log in to the GXS Bank app.
2. Proceed to the GXS Invest home screen.
3. Tap on the â€˜Buyâ€™ or â€˜Sellâ€™ buttons.
4. Input or select the amount you wish to buy or sell.
5. Select your GXS Savings Account to fund the purchase or to credit the proceeds.
6. Review your order details in the order summary page.
7. Acknowledge that you have read the Invest Account Terms, Fund Documents as well as Risk Disclosures.
8. Then tap on â€˜Buyâ€™ to proceed with the purchase or â€˜Sellâ€™ to proceed with the redemption.

Title: What are my responsibilities as a Protected GXS Biz Account holder? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Biz_Account/Keeping_your_GXS_Biz_Account_Payments_and_Money_Secure/What_are_my_responsibilities_as_a_Protected_GXS_Biz_Account_holder%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:28.295793
Word Count: 273
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Do:
Download the GXS Bank app from official app stores only (Apple App store or Google Play Store).
Install your app and device updates promptly.
Install and maintain the latest anti-virus software on your device.
Change your passcode regularly and do not share it with anyone.
Read notifications that may be sent by the bank very carefully.
Report to GXSÂ Bank immediately if you notice any unauthorised or erroneous transaction.
Keep your contact details (such as mobile number and email address) up to date with GXSÂ Bank so that we can send you transaction alerts.
Monitor your transaction alerts and account statements for any unauthorised and erroneous transactions.
Do not:
Disclose your banking credentials such as passcode and Singpass ID to anyone else for any purpose at all, including to initiate or execute payment transactions involving your account.
Use a passcode that can be easily guessed, such as your birthday, wedding day, or 123456.
Store or keep a record of your access code or Singpass ID in a way that allows any third party to easily misuse them.
Click on web links in push notifications or emails to access our website as these may be phishing attempts. Please always type our URL:Â www.gxs.com.sg/ into the browserâ€™s address bar.
Allow third parties to register their fingerprint or Face ID on your device.
The above practices are not exhaustive of all the measures you should take to protect your account. For further information, you can visit:
Terms of Use
Acceptable Use Policy
Security Tips
Deposit Account Terms
GXS FlexiLoan Terms and Conditions
For assistance on your Singpass access, do reach out to
Singpass Helpdesk
directly.

FAST

Data Privacy Policy
or Terms and Conditions, GXS cannot service your account. You will need to terminate your account in such cases.

Title: What are the fees I need to be aware of for GXS FlexiCard? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_FlexiCard/GXS_FlexiCard_Fees_and_Charges/What_are_the_fees_I_need_to_be_aware_of_for_GXS_FlexiCard%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:44.592850
Word Count: 165
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Here are the three fees associated with GXS FlexiCard:
Annual fee
Flexi fee
Late fee
Annual fee of S$54.50 (inclusive of GST) is waived for the first year.
From the second year onwards, the annual fee will be incurred on each anniversary of your GXS FlexiCard. For example, if you successfully applied for a GXS FlexiCard on 1 January 2025, the first annual fee of S$54.50 will be charged on 1 January 2026. And for all subsequent annual fees, you will be charged on 1 January of the following years.
Eligibility for a waiver in subsequent years is determined annually and is subject to bank review.
Flexi fee of S$5 will be incurred for each billing cycle where you only make a minimum payment for your FlexiCard on/before payment date, but did not make full payment.
Late fee of S$50 will be incurred for each billing cycle where we do not receive at least minimum payment on your GXS FlexiCard by the payment due date.

================================================================================

Title: What is a cooling-off period? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Payments/Cooling-Off_Period/What_is_a_cooling-off_period%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:09:57.591298
Word Count: 80
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

The cooling-off period is a safety measure that gives you 12 hours to respond and prevent any unauthorised changes to your daily transfer limits or personal information. This feature is activated when you complete one of the following actions:
1. Set up of the GXS Bank app on a new or existing mobile device.
2. Linking of GXS Savings Account to Dash/Grab app.
This measure is put in place to protect you from scammers attempting unauthorised transactions using your accounts.

================================================================================

Title: What are the different fund transfer and transaction limits? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Payments/Keeping_Your_Payments_Secure/What_are_the_different_fund_transfer_and_transaction_limits%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:10:00.664144
Word Count: 110
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Hereâ€™s an overview of the different fund transfers and transaction limits:
Pro tip: All transactions and transfers made via the GXS Bank app are instant. Best of all, there are no fees charged by GXS! You can send money to your friends and family, or scan and pay, all in a matter of seconds.
*Default Daily Limit is the limit set by GXS when you open a GXS Savings Account. You can easily change this limit via the GXS Bank app.
**Grab Wallet / Singtel Dash transactions refer to the amount of money you spend directly using funds from your linked GXS Savings Account on the Grab and Dash apps.

Title: What is eGIRO? - GXS Help Centre

Applicable to retail accounts only
eGIRO is a joint initiative by The Association of Banks in Singapore (ABS) and participating banks, with the support of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). eGIRO offers customers a convenient way to connect their external bank accounts and add funds to their GXS Savings Account effortlessly.
It's all about making banking smoother and more connected for you!

Title: Is there a daily limit for outgoing PayNow transactions when I use Scan QR on the GXS Bank app? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/GXS_Biz_Account/GXS_Biz_Account_Payments/Is_there_a_daily_limit_for_outgoing_PayNow_transactions_when_I_use_Scan_QR_on_the_GXS_Bank_app%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:10:15.828090
Word Count: 68
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

Yes, there is a daily limit for PayNow transactions using the Scan QR feature on the GXS Bank app. This limit is connected to your GXS Biz Account's daily transfer limit, which is set at a default of S$10,000. If you need to change this limit, you can do so by following these steps:
1. Go to 'Profile'.
2. Tap on 'Change Limits'.
3. Select 'Daily Transfer Limit'.

================================================================================

Title: What are the E-Payments User Protection Guidelines? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Payments/Keeping_Your_Payments_Secure/What_are_the_E-Payments_User_Protection_Guidelines%3F
Scraped: 2025-11-28T02:10:16.328776
Word Count: 243
Is FAQ Answer: True

================================================================================

The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has issued these Guidelines on the roles and responsibilities of banks and customers when it comes to Electronic Payments (E-Payments).
The Guidelines establish a common baseline protection that Financial Institutions will provide to individuals and sole proprietors from losses arising from unauthorised or erroneous e-payment transactions from their protected accounts.
What is a protected account?
In the Guidelines, protected accounts are:
Held by either individuals or sole proprietors (business owners), including those held jointly by multiple account holders, and can hold a balance of S$500 or more at any time or is a credit facility and is capable of being used for E-Payment transactions
What E-Payments do the Guidelines cover?
The Guidelines cover all payments initiated through electronic means, and funds received through electronic means. These include online payments and transfers.
How do the Guidelines protect me?
As an E-Payments user, the Guidelines set out your responsibilities to adopt good security practices. These include how you should protect your device, login credentials, access codes and protected accounts.
We send you transaction notifications so youâ€™re alerted of unauthorised transactions. There are also multiple channels of reaching us if you need to report any unauthorised transactions.
We will investigate claims of unauthorised transactions, with the aim of achieving a fair and reasonable resolution.
You can read about the Guidelines listed down by MAS and FAQs by ABS below.
E-Payment Guidelines from MAS:
www.mas.gov.sg/regulation/guidelines/guidelines-for-e-payments-user-protection
E-Payment Guidelines FAQ from ABS:
www.abs.org.sg/consumer-banking/consumers/faq---e-payment-guidelines

================================================================================

Title: Is there a daily limit for PayNow transactions when I use Scan QR on the GXS app? - GXS Help Centre
URL: https://help.gxs.com.sg/Payments/Using_Scan_QR/Is_there_a_daily_limit_for_PayNow_transactions_when_I_use_Scan_QR_on_the_GXS_app%3F

Tap on 'Change Limit'.
Select 'Daily Transfer Limit'.
